other Kroger associates at The Kroger Co. Annual Meeting of
Shareholders.</FONT></B></P>

    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%"></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top align=left width="1%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top align=left width="82%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>To elect eleven director nominees.</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="15%"></TD>

<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Proxy Statement</FONT></B></P>
<P align=right><FONT face=Arial size=2>May 12, 2016 </FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>We are providing
this notice, proxy statement and annual report to the shareholders of The Kroger
Co. (&#147;Kroger&#148;) in connection with the solicitation of proxies by the Board of
Directors for use at the Annual Meeting of Shareholders to be held on June 23,
2016, at 11:00 a.m. eastern time, at the School for Creative and Performing
Arts, Corbett Theater, 108 W. Central Parkway, Cincinnati, Ohio 45202, and at
any adjournments thereof.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Our principal
executive offices are located at 1014 Vine Street, Cincinnati, Ohio 45202-1100.
Our telephone number is 513-762-4000. This notice, proxy statement and annual
report, and the accompanying proxy card were first furnished to shareholders on
May 12, 2016.</FONT></P>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Who can vote?</FONT></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>You can vote if
as of the close of business on April 27, 2016, you were a shareholder of record
of Kroger common shares.</FONT></P>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Who is asking for my vote, and who pays
for this proxy solicitation?</FONT></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Your proxy is
being solicited by Kroger&#146;s Board of Directors. Kroger is paying the cost of
solicitation. We have hired D.F. King &amp; Co., Inc., 48 Wall Street, New York,
New York, a proxy solicitation firm to assist us in soliciting proxies and we
will pay them a fee estimated not to exceed $15,000.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>We also will
reimburse banks, brokers, nominees, and other fiduciaries for postage and
reasonable expenses incurred by them in forwarding the proxy material to
beneficial owners of our common shares.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Proxies may be
solicited personally, by telephone, electronically via the Internet, or by
mail.</FONT></P>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Who are the members of the Proxy
Committee?</FONT></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Robert D. Beyer,
W. Rodney McMullen, and Ronald L. Sargent, all Kroger Directors, are the members
of the Proxy Committee for our 2016 Annual Meeting.</FONT></P>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>How do I vote my proxy?</FONT></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>You can vote
your proxy in one of the following ways:</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; TEXT-ALIGN: left" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT face=Arial size=2>1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
      </FONT></TD>
    <TD width="100%"><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Via the internet,
      </FONT></I><FONT face=Arial size=2>by visiting
  www.proxyvote.com.</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD colSpan=2>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT face=Arial size=2>2.</FONT></TD>
    <TD width="100%"><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>By telephone, </FONT></I><FONT face=Arial size=2>by calling the number on your proxy card, voting
      instruction form, or notice.</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD colSpan=2>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT face=Arial size=2>3.</FONT></TD>
    <TD width="100%"><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>By mail, </FONT></I><FONT face=Arial size=2>by marking, signing, dating and mailing your proxy card
      if you requested printed materials, or your voting instruction form. No
      postage is required if mailed in the United States.</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD colSpan=2>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT face=Arial size=2>4.</FONT></TD>
    <TD width="100%"><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>In person, </FONT></I><FONT face=Arial size=2>by attending the meeting in
  Cincinnati.</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>What do I need to attend the meeting in
person in Cincinnati?</FONT></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>If you plan to
attend the meeting, you must bring either: (1) the notice of meeting that was
separately mailed to you or (2) the top portion of your proxy card, either of
which will be your admission ticket.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>You must also
bring valid photo identification, such as a driver&#146;s license or
passport.</FONT></P>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Can I change or revoke my
proxy?</FONT></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>The common
shares represented by each proxy will be voted in the manner you specified
unless your proxy is revoked before it is exercised. You may change or revoke
your proxy by providing written notice to Kroger&#146;s Secretary at 1014 Vine
Street, Cincinnati, Ohio 45202-1100, in person at the meeting or by executing
and sending us a subsequent proxy.</FONT></P>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>How many shares are
outstanding?</FONT></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>As of the close
of business on April 27, 2016, the record date, our outstanding voting
securities consisted of 953,786,557 common shares.</FONT></P>
<P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial>1</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>How many votes per
share?</FONT></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Each common
share outstanding on the record date will be entitled to one vote on each of the
11 director nominees and one vote on each other proposal. Shareholders may not
cumulate votes in the election of directors.</FONT></P>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>What voting instructions can I
provide?</FONT></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>You may instruct
the proxies to vote &#147;For&#148; or &#147;Against&#148; each proposal. Or you may instruct the
proxies to &#147;Abstain&#148; from voting.</FONT></P>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>What happens if proxy cards or voting
instruction forms are returned without instructions?</FONT></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>If you are a
registered shareholder and you return your proxy card without instructions, the
Proxy Committee will vote in accordance with the recommendations of the Board of
Directors.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>If you hold
shares in street name and do not provide your broker with specific voting
instructions on proposals 1, 2, 4, 5, 6 or 7, which are considered non-routine
matters, your broker does not have the authority to vote on those proposals.
This is generally referred to as a &#147;broker non-vote.&#148; Proposal 3, ratification
of auditors, is considered a routine matter and, therefore, your broker may vote
your shares according to your broker&#146;s discretion.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>The vote
required, including the effect of broker non-votes and abstentions for each of
the matters presented for shareholder vote, is set forth below.</FONT></P>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>What are the voting requirements for
each of the proposals?</FONT></B></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Proposal No. 1, Election of
Directors</FONT></B><FONT face=Arial size=2> &#150; An affirmative vote of the
majority of the total number of votes cast &#147;For&#148; or &#147;Against&#148; a director nominee
is required for the election of a director in an uncontested election. A
majority of votes cast means that the number of shares voted &#147;For&#148; a director
nominee must exceed the number of votes &#147;Against&#148; such director. Broker
non-votes and abstentions will have no effect on this proposal.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Proposal No. 2, Advisory Vote to
Approve Executive Compensation</FONT></B><FONT face=Arial size=2> &#150; Advisory
approval by shareholders of executive compensation requires the affirmative vote
of the majority of shares participating in the voting. Broker non-votes and
abstentions will have no effect on this proposal.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Proposal No. 3, Ratification of
Independent Auditors</FONT></B><FONT face=Arial size=2> &#150; Ratification by
shareholders of the selection of independent public accountants requires the
affirmative vote of the majority of shares participating in the voting.
Abstentions will have no effect on this proposal.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Proposal Nos. 4, 5, 6 and 7,
Shareholder Proposals </FONT></B><FONT face=Arial size=2>&#150; The affirmative vote
of the majority of shares participating in the voting on a shareholder proposal
is required for such proposal to pass. Accordingly, broker non-votes and
abstentions will have no effect on these proposals. Proxies will be voted
against these proposals unless the Proxy Committee is otherwise instructed on a
proxy properly executed and returned.</FONT></P>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>How does the Board of Directors
recommend that I vote?</FONT></B></P>
<TABLE style="LINE-HEIGHT: 14pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR vAlign=bottom>
    <TD noWrap style="text-align: center" width="90%"><STRONG><FONT face=Arial size=2>Proposal</FONT></STRONG></TD>
    <TD noWrap style="text-align: center" width="5%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </TD>
    <TD noWrap style="text-align: center" width="5%"><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Board Recommendation</FONT></B></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=bottom>
    <TD noWrap align=left width="90%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>Item No. 1, Election of Directors</FONT></TD>
    <TD noWrap style="text-align: center" width="5%"></TD>

  <TR vAlign=bottom>

	<div style="padding: 2pt; border: 1pt solid #000000">
<div align=center><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Important Notice Regarding the
Availability of Proxy Materials for the Shareholder<BR>Meeting to be Held on
June 23, 2016</FONT></B></div><BR>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>The Notice of
2016 Annual Meeting, Proxy Statement and 2015 Annual Report and the means to
vote by internet are available at www.proxyvote.com.</FONT></div></div>
<P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial>2</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Kroger&#146;s Corporate Governance
Practices</FONT></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Kroger is
committed to strong corporate governance. We believe that strong governance
builds trust and promotes the long-term interests of our shareholders.
Highlights of our corporate governance practices include the
following:</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; TEXT-ALIGN: left" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR vAlign=bottom>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>&#10003;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>&nbsp; </FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top align=left width="97%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>All director nominees are
      independent, except for the CEO.<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=bottom>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%"></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>&#10003;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%"></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top align=left width="97%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>All five Board Committees are fully
      independent.<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=bottom>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%"></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>&#10003;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%"></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top align=left width="97%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>Annual election of all
      directors.<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=bottom>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%"></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>&#10003;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%"></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top align=left width="97%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>All directors are elected with a
      simple majority standard for all uncontested director elections, with
      cumulative voting available in contested director
      elections.<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=bottom>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%"></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>&#10003;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%"></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top align=left width="97%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>Commitment to Board refreshment and
      diversity.<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=bottom>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%"></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>&#10003;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%"></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top align=left width="97%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>Regular engagement with shareholders
      to understand their perspectives and concerns.<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=bottom>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%"></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>&#10003;</FONT></TD>

      independent directors, at board and committee
level.<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=bottom>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%"></TD>

    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%"></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top align=left width="97%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>Strong independent lead director with
      clearly defined roles and responsibilities.<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=bottom>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%"></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>&#10003;</FONT></TD>

      self-assessments.<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>

      CEO by the independent directors.<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=bottom>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%"></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>&#10003;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%"></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top align=left width="97%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>High degree of Board interaction with
      management to ensure successful oversight and succession
      planning.<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=bottom>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%"></TD>

      executive and director interests with those of
      shareholders.<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>

      sales and pledging.<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>

    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%"></TD>

    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%"></TD>

      plan).<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=bottom>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%"></TD>

      special meeting.<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>

<P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial>3</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>
<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<!-- B -->
<P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Proposals to
Shareholders</FONT></B></P>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Item 1. Election of
Directors</FONT></B></P>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>You are being asked to elect 11
director nominees for a one-year term. The Board of Directors recommends that
you vote FOR the election of all director nominees.</FONT></B></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>As of the date of this proxy statement,
the Kroger Board of Directors consists of twelve members. David B. Lewis will be
retiring from the Board of Directors immediately prior to the 2016 annual
meeting, in accordance with Kroger&#146;s director retirement policy, and will not be
standing for re-election. The number of directors will be reduced to eleven by
the Board. All nominees, if elected at the 2016 annual meeting, will serve until
the annual meeting in 2017, or until their successors have been elected by the
shareholders or by the Board pursuant to Kroger&#146;s Regulations, and
qualified.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>Kroger&#146;s Articles of Incorporation provide
that the vote required for election of a director nominee by the shareholders,
except in a contested election or when cumulative voting is in effect, is the
affirmative vote of a majority of the votes cast for or against the election of
a nominee.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>The experience, qualifications,
attributes, and skills that led the Corporate Governance Committee and the Board
to conclude that the following individuals should serve as directors are set
forth opposite each individual&#146;s name. The committee memberships stated below
are those in effect as of the date of this proxy statement. Except as noted,
each nominee has been employed by his or her present employer (or a subsidiary
thereof) in an executive capacity for at least five years.</FONT></P>
<P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Nominees for Directors for Terms of
Office Continuing until 2017</FONT></B></P>
<TABLE style="BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR vAlign=bottom>
    <TD STYLE="border-top: #000000 1pt solid; border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: top; text-align: left; width: 20%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt">
      <P><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Nora A. Aufreiter</FONT></B></P>
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Age 56</FONT></P>
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Director Since 2014</FONT></P>
      <P align=left><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Committees:<BR></FONT></I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Financial
    Policy<BR>Public<BR>Responsibilities</FONT></P></TD>
    <TD NOWRAP STYLE="border-top: #000000 1pt solid; border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: top; text-align: left; width: 1%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD STYLE="border-top: #000000 1pt solid; border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: top; text-align: left; width: 79%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt">
      <P STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial size=2>Ms. Aufreiter is a Director Emeritus
      of McKinsey &amp; Company, a global management consulting firm. She
      retired in June 2014 after more than 27 years with McKinsey, most recently
      as a director and senior partner. During that time, she worked extensively
      in the U.S., Canada, and internationally with major retailers, financial
      institutions and other consumer-facing companies. Before joining McKinsey,
      Ms. Aufreiter spent three years in financial services working in corporate
      finance and investment banking. She is a member of the Board of Directors
      of The Bank of Nova Scotia, The Neiman Marcus Group, and Cadillac
      Fairview, one of North America&#146;s largest owners, operators and developers
      of commercial real estate. Ms. Aufreiter also serves on the boards of St.
      Michael&#146;s Hospital and the Canadian Opera Company, and is a member of the
      Dean&#146;s Advisory Board for the Ivey Business School in Ontario,
      Canada.</FONT></P>
      <P STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial size=2>Ms. Aufreiter has over 30 years of
      broad business experience in a variety of retail sectors. Her vast
      experience in leading McKinsey&#146;s North American Retail Practice, North
      American Branding service line and the Consumer Digital and Omnichannel
      service line is of particular value to the Board. She also brings to the
      Board valuable insight on commercial real
estate.</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE><BR>

    <TD STYLE="border-top: #000000 1pt solid; border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: top; text-align: left; width: 79%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt">
      <P STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial size=2>Mr. Beyer is Chairman of Chaparal
      Investments LLC, a private investment firm and holding company that he
      founded in 2009. From 2005 to 2009, Mr. Beyer served as Chief Executive
      Officer of The TCW Group, Inc., a global investment management firm. From
      2000 to 2005, he served as President and Chief Investment Officer of Trust
      Company of the West, the principal operating subsidiary of TCW. Mr. Beyer
      is a member of the Board of Directors of The Allstate Corporation and
      Leucadia National Corporation. Mr. Beyer has decided not to seek
      re-election to Allstate&#146;s board of directors at its annual meeting in May
      2016, after ten years of service on its board.</FONT></P>
      <P STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial size=2>Mr. Beyer brings to Kroger his
      experience as CEO of TCW, a global investment management firm serving many
      of the largest institutional investors in the U.S. He has exceptional
      insight into Kroger&#146;s financial strategy, and his experience qualifies him
      to serve as a member of the Board. While at TCW, he also conceived and
      developed the firm&#146;s risk management infrastructure, an experience that is
      useful to Kroger&#146;s Board in performing its risk management oversight
      functions. His abilities and service as a director were recognized by his
      peers, who selected Mr. Beyer as an Outstanding Director in 2008 as part
      of the Outstanding Directors Program of the Financial Times. His strong
      insights into corporate governance form the foundation of his leadership
      role as Lead Director on the Board.</FONT></P></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=bottom>
    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: top; text-align: left; width: 20%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt"><P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Anne

      <P STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial size=2>Ms. Gates is President of MGA
      Entertainment, Inc., a privately-held developer, manufacturer and marketer
      of toy and entertainment products for children, a position she has held
      since 2014. Ms. Gates held roles of increasing responsibility with The
      Walt Disney Company from 1992-2012. Her roles included executive vice
      president, managing director and chief financial officer for Disney
      Consumer Products and senior vice president of operations, planning and
      analysis. Prior to joining Disney, Ms. Gates worked for PepsiCo and Bear
      Stearns.</FONT></P>
      <P STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial size=2>Ms. Gates has over 15 years of
      experience in the retail and consumer products industry. She brings to
      Kroger financial expertise gained while serving as President of MGA and
      CFO of a division of the Walt Disney Company. Ms. Gates has a broad
      business background in marketing, strategy and business development,
      including international business. Her expertise in toy and entertainment
      products is of particular value to the Board. Ms. Gates has been
      designated an Audit Committee financial expert.</FONT></P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: top; text-align: left; width: 20%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt">

      Operating Officer of Avon Products Inc., a manufacturer and marketer of
      beauty care products, from 2001 until her retirement in January 2007. She
      joined Avon in 1970 and, during her tenure at Avon, Ms. Kropf also served
      as Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer, Avon North
      America and Global Business Operations from 1998 to 2000 and President,
      Avon U.S. from 1997 to 1998. Ms. Kropf was a member of Avon&#146;s Board of
      Directors from 1998 to 2006. She currently is a director of Avon Products
      Inc., Coach, Inc., and Sherwin Williams Company. In the past five years
      she also served as a director of MeadWestvaco Corporation.</FONT></P>
      <P STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial size=2>Ms. Kropf has unique and valuable
      consumer insight, having led a major, publicly-traded retailer of beauty
      and related consumer products. She has extensive experience in
      manufacturing, marketing, supply chain operations, customer service, and
      product development, all of which assist her in her role as a member of
      Kroger&#146;s Board. Ms. Kropf has a strong financial background, and has
      significant boardroom experience through her service on the boards of
      various public companies, including experience serving on compensation,
      audit, and corporate governance committees. She was inducted into the YWCA
      Academy of Women Achievers.</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE><BR>

  <TR>
    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: top; text-align: left; width: 20%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt">
      <P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Susan M. Phillips</FONT></B></P>
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Age 71</FONT></P>
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Director Since 2003</FONT></P>
      <P align=left><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Committees:<BR></FONT></I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Audit<BR></FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2>Compensation</FONT></P></TD>
    <TD NOWRAP STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; text-align: left; width: 1%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt"></TD>
    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: top; text-align: left; width: 79%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt">
      <P STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial size=2>Dr. Phillips is Professor Emeritus
      of Finance at The George Washington University School of Business. She
      joined The George Washington University School of Business as a Professor
      and Dean in 1998. Dr. Phillips retired from her position as Dean in 2010,
      and retired from her position as Professor the following year. She was a
      member of the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System from
      December 1991 through June 1998. Before her Federal Reserve appointment,
      Dr. Phillips served as Vice President for Finance and University Services
      and Professor of Finance in The College of Business Administration at the
      University of Iowa from 1987 through 1991. She is a director of CBOE
      Holdings, Inc., State Farm Mutual Automobile Insurance Company, State Farm
      Companies Foundation, the Chicago Board Options Exchange, and Agnes Scott
      College. Dr. Phillips also was a director of the National Futures
      Association and State Farm Life Insurance Company until early
      2016.</FONT></P>
      <P STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial size=2>Dr. Phillips brings to the Board
      strong financial acumen, along with a deep understanding of, and
      involvement with, the relationship between corporations and the
      government. Her experience in academia brings a unique and diverse
      viewpoint to the Board&#146;s deliberations. Dr. Phillips has been designated
      an Audit Committee financial expert.</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE><BR>
<P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial>6</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<TABLE style="BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR vAlign=bottom>
    <TD STYLE="border-top: #000000 1pt solid; border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: top; text-align: left; width: 20%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt">
      <P><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>James A. Runde</FONT></B></P>
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Age 69</FONT></P>
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Director Since 2006</FONT></P>
      <P align=left><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Committees:<BR></FONT></I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Compensation<BR>Financial Policy</FONT></P></TD>
    <TD NOWRAP STYLE="border-top: #000000 1pt solid; border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; text-align: left; width: 1%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD STYLE="border-top: #000000 1pt solid; border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: top; text-align: left; width: 79%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Mr. Runde is a special advisor and a
      former Vice Chairman of Morgan Stanley, a financial services provider,
      where he was employed from 1974 until his retirement in 2015. He was a
      member of the Board of Directors of Burlington Resources Inc. prior to its
      acquisition by ConocoPhillips in 2006. Mr. Runde serves as a Trustee
      Emeritus of Marquette University and the Pierpont Morgan
      Library.</FONT></P>
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Mr. Runde brings to Kroger&#146;s Board a
      strong financial background, having led a major financial services
      provider. He has served on the compensation committee of a major
      corporation.</FONT></P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: top; text-align: left; width: 20%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt">
      <P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Ronald L. Sargent</FONT></B></P>
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Age 60</FONT></P>
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Director Since 2006</FONT></P>
      <P align=left><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Committees</FONT></I><FONT face=Arial size=2>:<BR>Audit<BR></FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2>Public
      Responsibilities</FONT></P></TD>
    <TD NOWRAP STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; text-align: left; width: 1%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: top; text-align: left; width: 79%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Mr. Sargent is Chairman and Chief
      Executive Officer of Staples, Inc., a business products retailer, where he
      has been employed since 1989. Prior to joining Staples, Mr. Sargent spent
      10 years with Kroger in various positions. In addition to serving as a
      director of Staples, Mr. Sargent is a director of Five Below, Inc. During
      the past five years, he was a director of Mattel, Inc. and The Home Depot,
      Inc.</FONT></P>
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Mr. Sargent has over 35 years of
      retail experience, first with Kroger and then with increasing levels of
      responsibility and leadership at Staples, Inc. His efforts helped carve
      out a new market niche for the international retailer that he leads. His
      understanding of retail operations and consumer insights are of particular
      value to the Board. Mr. Sargent has been designated an Audit Committee
      financial expert.</FONT></P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: top; text-align: left; width: 20%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt">
      <P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Bobby S. Shackouls</FONT></B></P>
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Age 65</FONT></P>
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Director Since 1999</FONT></P>
      <P align=left><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Committees:<BR></FONT></I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Audit<BR></FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2>Corporate
      Governance</FONT></P></TD>
    <TD NOWRAP STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; text-align: left; width: 1%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt"></TD>
    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: top; text-align: left; width: 79%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Mr. Shackouls was Chairman of the
      Board of Burlington Resources Inc., a natural resources business, from
      July 1997 until its merger with ConocoPhillips in 2006 and its President
      and Chief Executive Officer from December 1995 until 2006. Mr. Shackouls
      was also the President and Chief Executive Officer of Burlington Resources
      Oil and Gas Company (formerly known as Meridian Oil Inc.), a wholly-owned
      subsidiary of Burlington Resources, from 1994 to 1995. Mr. Shackouls is a
      director of Plains GP Holdings, L.P. and Oasis Petroleum Inc. During the
      past five years, Mr. Shackouls was a director of ConocoPhillips and PNGS
      GP LLC, the general partner of PAA Natural Gas Storage, L.P. Mr. Shackouls
      previously served as Kroger&#146;s Lead Director.</FONT></P>
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Mr. Shackouls brings to the Board
      the critical thinking that comes with a chemical engineering background,
      as well as his experience leading a major natural resources company,
      coupled with his corporate governance
expertise.</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE><BR>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>The Board of Directors Recommends a
Vote <U>For</U> Each Director Nominee.</FONT></B></P>
<P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial>7</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Information Concerning the Board of
Directors</FONT></B></P>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Board Leadership Structure and Lead
Independent Director</FONT></B></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>The Board is currently composed of eleven
independent non-employee directors and one management director, Mr. McMullen,
the Chairman and CEO. Kroger has a balanced governance structure in which
independent directors exercise meaningful and vigorous oversight.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>In addition, as provided in the
</FONT><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Guidelines on Issues of Corporate Governance
</FONT></I><FONT face=Arial size=2>(the &#147;</FONT><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Guidelines</FONT></I><FONT face=Arial size=2>&#148;), the Board has designated
one of the independent directors as Lead Director. The Lead Director works with
the Chairman to share governance responsibilities, facilitate the development of
Kroger&#146;s strategy and grow shareholder value. The Lead Director serves a variety
of roles, consistent with current best practices, including:</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial>reviewing and approving Board meeting
      agendas, materials and schedules to confirm the</FONT> <FONT face=Arial size=2>appropriate topics are reviewed and sufficient time is allocated to
      each;</FONT> <BR>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial>serving as the principal liaison between
      the Chairman, management and the non-management</FONT> <FONT face=Arial size=2>directors;</FONT> <BR>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial>presiding at the executive sessions of
      independent directors and at all other meetings of the Board</FONT> <FONT face=Arial size=2>at which the Chairman is not present;</FONT>
    <BR>&nbsp;</TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial>calling meetings of independent
      directors at any time; and</FONT> <BR>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left">
      <P STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial>serving as the Board&#146;s representative for any
      consultation and direct communication, following a</FONT> <FONT face=Arial size=2>request, with major shareholders.</FONT></P>
      <P STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial size=2>The Lead Director carries out these
      responsibilities in numerous ways, including:</FONT><BR>&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial>facilitating communication and
      collegiality among the Board;</FONT> <BR>&nbsp;</TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial>soliciting direct feedback from
      non-executive directors;</FONT> <BR>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial>overseeing the succession process,
      including site visits and meeting with a wide range of corporate</FONT>
      <FONT face=Arial size=2>and division management associates;</FONT>
    <BR>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial>meeting with the CEO frequently to
      discuss strategy;</FONT> <BR>&nbsp;</TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial>serving as a sounding board
      and advisor to the CEO; and</FONT> <BR>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial>discussing Company matters
      with other directors between meetings.</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>Unless otherwise determined by the Board,
the chair of the Corporate Governance Committee is designated as the Lead
Director. Robert Beyer, an independent director and the chair of the Corporate
Governance Committee, is currently the Lead Director. Mr. Beyer is an effective
Lead Director for Kroger due to, among other things, his independence, his deep
strategic and operational understanding of Kroger obtained while serving as a
Kroger director, his insight into corporate governance, his experience on the
boards of other large publicly traded companies, and his commitment and
engagement to carrying out the roles and responsibilities of the Lead Director.
</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>With respect to the roles of Chairman and
CEO, the </FONT><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Guidelines</FONT></I><FONT face=Arial size=2> provide that the Board will determine when it is in the best interests
of Kroger and our shareholders for the roles to be separated or combined, and
the Board exercises its discretion as it deems appropriate in light of
prevailing circumstances. Upon retirement of our former Chairman, David B.
Dillon, on December 31, 2014, the Board determined that it is in the best
interests of Kroger and our shareholders for one person to serve as the Chairman
and CEO, as was the case from 2004 through 2013. The Board believes that this
leadership structure improves the Board&#146;s ability to focus on key policy and
operational issues and helps the Company operate in the long-term interests of
shareholders. Additionally, this structure provides an effective balance between
strong Company leadership and appropriate safeguards and oversight by
independent directors. The Board believes that the combination or separation of
these positions should continue to be considered as part of the succession
planning process, as was the case in 2003 and 2014 when the roles were
separated. </FONT></P>
<P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial>8</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>The Board and each of its committees
conduct an annual self-evaluation to determine whether the Board is functioning
effectively at each level. As part of this annual self-evaluation, the Board
assesses whether the current leadership structure continues to be appropriate
for Kroger and its shareholders. The </FONT><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Guidelines</FONT></I><FONT face=Arial size=2> provide the flexibility for
the Board to modify our leadership structure in the future as appropriate. We
believe that Kroger, like many U.S. companies, has been well-served by this
flexible leadership structure.</FONT></P>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Committees of the Board of
Directors</FONT></B></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>To assist the Board in undertaking its
responsibilities, and to allow deeper engagement in certain areas of company
oversight, the Board has established five standing committees: Audit,
Compensation, Corporate Governance, Financial Policy and Public
Responsibilities. All committees are composed exclusively of independent
directors, as determined under the NYSE listing standards. The current charter
of each Board committee is available on our website at ir.kroger.com under
Corporate Governance &#150; Committee Composition.</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR vAlign=bottom>
    <TD NOWRAP STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1.5pt solid; text-align: center; width: 35%; background-color: #c0c0c0; padding-bottom: 2pt; padding-left: 4pt"><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Name of Committee, Number
      of<BR>Meetings, and Current Members</FONT></B></TD>
    <TD NOWRAP STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1.5pt solid; text-align: left; width: 1%; background-color: #c0c0c0; padding-bottom: 2pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD NOWRAP STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1.5pt solid; text-align: center; width: 63%; background-color: #c0c0c0; padding-bottom: 2pt"><STRONG><FONT face=Arial size=2>Committee Functions</FONT></STRONG></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=bottom>
    <TD NOWRAP STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: top; text-align: left; width: 35%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt">

      <P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Meetings in 2015:
      </FONT></B><FONT face=Arial size=2>5</FONT></P>
      <P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Members:<BR>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Ronald L. Sargent, </FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2><EM>Chair<BR></EM><STRONG>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</STRONG></FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2>Anne
      Gates<BR><STRONG>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</STRONG>Susan J.
      Kropf<BR><STRONG>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</STRONG>Susan M.
      Phillips<BR><STRONG>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</STRONG>Bobby S.
      Shackouls</FONT></P></TD>
    <TD NOWRAP STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: top; text-align: left; width: 1%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: top; text-align: left; width: 63%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt">
      <DIV STYLE="padding-left: 15pt; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: -14.5pt; text-align: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2><FONT face=Arial size=2>Oversees the
      Company&#146;s financial reporting and accounting matters, including review of
      the Company&#146;s financial statements and the audit thereof, the Company&#146;s
      financial reporting and accounting process, and the Company&#146;s systems of
      internal control over financial reporting<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></DIV>
      <DIV STYLE="padding-left: 15pt; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: -14.5pt; text-align: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2><FONT face=Arial size=2>Selects, evaluates
      and oversees the compensation and work of the independent registered
      public accounting firm and reviews its performance, qualifications, and
      independence<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></DIV>
      <DIV STYLE="padding-left: 15pt; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: -14.5pt; text-align: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2><FONT face=Arial size=2>Oversees and
      evaluates the Company&#146;s internal audit function, including review of its
      audit plan, policies and procedures and significant
      findings<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></DIV>
      <DIV STYLE="padding-left: 15pt; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: -14.5pt; text-align: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2>Oversees risk
      assessment and risk management, including review of legal or regulatory
      matters that could have a significant effect on the
      Company<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></DIV>
      <DIV STYLE="padding-left: 15pt; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: -14.5pt; text-align: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2><FONT face=Arial size=2>Reviews and monitors
      the Company&#146;s compliance programs, including the whistleblower
      program&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></DIV></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD NOWRAP STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: top; text-align: left; width: 35%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt">
      <P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Compensation
      Committee</FONT></B></P>
      <P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Meetings in 2015:
      </FONT></B><FONT face=Arial size=2>5</FONT></P>

      Montoya<BR><STRONG>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</STRONG>Susan M.
      Phillips<BR>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;James A. Runde</FONT></P></TD>
    <TD NOWRAP STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: top; text-align: left; width: 1%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt"></TD>

      approval by the independent directors the compensation of the CEO, and
      determines the compensation of other senior management and
      directors<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></DIV>

      to retain and direct the committee&#146;s compensation
