      Board with senior management succession
    planning</FONT></FONT></DIV></TD></TR></TABLE><BR>
<P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial>9</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<TABLE style="BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR vAlign=bottom>
    <TD NOWRAP STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1.5pt solid; text-align: center; width: 35%; background-color: #c0c0c0; padding-bottom: 2pt; padding-left: 4pt"><STRONG><FONT face=Arial size=2>Name of
      Committee, Number of<BR>Meetings, and Current Members</FONT></STRONG></TD>
    <TD NOWRAP STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1.5pt solid; text-align: center; width: 64%; background-color: #c0c0c0; padding-bottom: 2pt"><STRONG><FONT face=Arial size=2>Committee Functions</FONT></STRONG></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=bottom>
    <TD STYLE="vertical-align: top; text-align: left; width: 35%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid">
      <P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Corporate Governance
      Committee<BR>&nbsp;<BR></FONT></B><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Meetings in
      2015: </FONT></B><FONT face=Arial size=2>2<BR>&nbsp;<BR></FONT><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Members:<BR></FONT></B><FONT face=Arial size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Robert D. Beyer, </FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2><EM>Chair<BR></EM>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2>David B. Lewis<BR>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Clyde R.
      Moore<BR>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Bobby S. Shackouls</FONT></P></TD>
    <TD STYLE="vertical-align: top; text-align: left; width: 64%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid">
      <DIV STYLE="padding-left: 30pt; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: -14.5pt; text-align: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2><FONT face=Arial size=2>Oversees the
      Company&#146;s corporate governance policies and
      procedures<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></DIV>
      <DIV STYLE="padding-left: 30pt; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: -14.5pt; text-align: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2><FONT face=Arial size=2>Develops criteria
      for selecting and retaining directors and identifies and recommends
      qualified candidates to be director nominees<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></DIV>
      <DIV STYLE="padding-left: 30pt; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: -14.5pt; text-align: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2><FONT face=Arial size=2>Designates
      membership and chairs of Board committees<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></DIV>
      <DIV STYLE="padding-left: 30pt; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: -14.5pt; text-align: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2><FONT face=Arial size=2>Reviews the Board&#146;s
      performance and director independence<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></DIV>
      <DIV STYLE="padding-left: 30pt; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: -14.5pt; text-align: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2><FONT face=Arial size=2>Reviews, along with
      the other independent directors, the performance of the
      CEO</FONT></FONT></DIV></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD STYLE="vertical-align: top; text-align: left; width: 35%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid">
      <P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Financial Policy
      Committee<BR></FONT></B><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>&nbsp;<BR>Meetings in
      2015: </FONT></B><FONT face=Arial size=2>2<BR>&nbsp;<BR></FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2><STRONG>Members:<BR></STRONG>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2>James A. Runde, </FONT><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Chair<BR></FONT></I><FONT face=Arial size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Nora A.
      Aufreiter<BR>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Robert D.
      Beyer<BR>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Susan J. Kropf</FONT></P></TD>
    <TD STYLE="vertical-align: top; text-align: left; width: 64%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid">
      <DIV STYLE="padding-left: 30pt; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: -14.5pt; text-align: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2><FONT face=Arial size=2>Reviews and
      recommends financial policies and practices<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></DIV>
      <DIV STYLE="padding-left: 30pt; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: -14.5pt; text-align: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2><FONT face=Arial size=2>Oversees management
      of the Company&#146;s financial resources<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></DIV>
      <DIV STYLE="padding-left: 30pt; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: -14.5pt; text-align: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2><FONT face=Arial size=2>Reviews the
      Company&#146;s annual financial plan, significant capital investments, plans
      for major acquisitions or sales, issuance of new common or preferred
      stock, dividend policy, creation of additional debt and other capital
      structure considerations including additional leverage or dilution in
      ownership<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></DIV>
      <DIV STYLE="padding-left: 30pt; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: -14.5pt; text-align: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2><FONT face=Arial size=2>Monitors the
      investment management of assets held in pension and profit sharing plans
      administered by the Company</FONT></FONT></DIV></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD STYLE="vertical-align: top; text-align: left; width: 35%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid">
      <P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Public Responsibilities
      Committee<BR>&nbsp;<BR></FONT></B><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Meetings in
      2015: </FONT></B><FONT face=Arial size=2>2<BR></FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2>&nbsp;<BR><STRONG>Members:<BR></STRONG>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2>Jorge P. Montoya, </FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2><EM>Chair<BR></EM>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2>Nora A. Aufreiter<BR>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Anne
      Gates<BR>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Ronald L. Sargent</FONT></P></TD>
    <TD STYLE="vertical-align: top; text-align: left; width: 64%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid">
      <DIV STYLE="padding-left: 30pt; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: -14.5pt; text-align: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2><FONT face=Arial size=2>Reviews the
      Company&#146;s policies and practices affecting its social and public
      responsibility as a corporate citizen, including: community relations,
      charitable giving, supplier diversity, sustainability, government
      relations, political action, consumer and media relations, food and
      pharmacy safety and the safety of customers and
      employees<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></DIV>
      <DIV STYLE="padding-left: 30pt; font-size: 10pt; text-indent: -14.5pt; text-align: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2><FONT face=Arial size=2>Reviews and examines
      the Company&#146;s evaluation of and response to changing public expectations
      and public issues affecting the
business</FONT></FONT></DIV></TD></TR></TABLE><BR>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Director Nominee Selection
Process</FONT></B></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>The Corporate Governance Committee is
responsible for recommending to the Board a slate of nominees for election at
each annual meeting of shareholders. The Corporate Governance Committee recruits
candidates for Board membership through its own efforts and through
recommendations from other directors and shareholders. In addition, the
Corporate Governance Committee has retained an independent search firm to assist
in identifying and recruiting director candidates who meet the criteria
established by the Corporate Governance Committee.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>These criteria are:</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial>Demonstrated ability in fields considered
      to be of value in the deliberation and long-term planning</FONT> <FONT face=Arial size=2>of the Board, including business management, public
      service, education, technology, law and</FONT> <FONT face=Arial size=2>government;</FONT> <BR>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial>Highest standards of personal character and
      conduct;</FONT> <BR>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial>Willingness to fulfill the obligations of
      directors and to make the contribution of which he or she is</FONT> <FONT face=Arial size=2>capable, including regular attendance and participation
      at Board and committee meetings, and</FONT> <FONT face=Arial size=2>preparation for all meetings, including review of all meeting
      materials provided in advance of the meeting;</FONT> <FONT face=Arial size=2>and</FONT> <BR>&nbsp;</TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial>Ability to understand the
      perspectives of Kroger&#146;s customers, taking into consideration the
      diversity</FONT> <FONT face=Arial size=2>of our customers, including
      regional and geographic differences.</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial>10</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>The Corporate Governance Committee
considers racial, ethnic and gender diversity to be important elements in
promoting full, open and balanced deliberations of issues presented to the
Board. The Corporate Governance Committee considers director candidates that
help the Board reflect the diversity of our shareholders, associates, customers
and the communities in which we operate. Some consideration also is given to the
geographic location of director candidates in order to provide a reasonable
distribution of members from Kroger&#146;s operating areas.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>At least annually, the Corporate
Governance Committee actively engages in Board succession planning. The
Corporate Governance Committee takes into account the Board and committee
evaluations regarding the specific backgrounds, skills, and experiences that
would contribute to overall Board and committee effectiveness as well as the
future needs of the Board and its committees in light of Kroger&#146;s current and
future business strategies and the skills and qualifications of directors who
are expected to retire in the future.</FONT></P>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Candidates Nominated by
Shareholders</FONT></B></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>The Corporate Governance Committee will
consider shareholder recommendations for nominees for membership on the Board of
Directors. If shareholders wish to nominate a person or persons for election to
the Board at our 2017 annual meeting, written notice must be submitted to
Kroger&#146;s Secretary, and received at our executive offices, in accordance with
Kroger&#146;s Regulations, not later than March 28, 2017. Such notice should include
the name, age, business address and residence address of such person, the
principal occupation or employment of such person, the number of Kroger common
shares owned of record or beneficially by such person and any other information
relating to the person that would be required to be included in a proxy
statement relating to the election of directors. The Secretary will forward the
information to the Corporate Governance Committee for its consideration. The
Corporate Governance Committee will use the same criteria in evaluating
candidates submitted by shareholders as it uses in evaluating candidates
identified by the Corporate Governance Committee, as described above.
</FONT></P>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Corporate Governance
Guidelines</FONT></B></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>The Board has adopted the </FONT><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Guidelines</FONT></I><FONT face=Arial size=2>. The
</FONT><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Guidelines</FONT></I><FONT face=Arial size=2>,
which include copies of the current charters for each of the five standing
committees of the Board, are available on our website at ir.kroger.com under
Corporate Governance &#150; Highlights. Shareholders may obtain a copy of the
</FONT><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Guidelines</FONT></I><FONT face=Arial size=2>
by making a written request to Kroger&#146;s Secretary at our executive
offices.</FONT></P>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Independence</FONT></B></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>The Board has determined that all of the
non-employee directors have no material relationships with Kroger and,
therefore, are independent for purposes of the New York Stock Exchange listing
standards. The Board made its determination based on information furnished by
all members regarding their relationships with Kroger and its management, and
other relevant information. After reviewing the information, the Board
determined that all of the non-employee directors were independent
because:</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial>they all satisfied the criteria for
      independence set forth in Rule 303A.02 of the NYSE Listed</FONT> <FONT face=Arial size=2>Company Manual,</FONT> <BR>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial>the value of any business transactions
      between Kroger and entities with which the directors are</FONT> <FONT face=Arial size=2>affiliated falls below the thresholds identified by the
      NYSE listing standards, and</FONT> <BR>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial>none had any material relationships with
      Kroger except for those arising directly from their</FONT> <FONT face=Arial size=2>performance of services as a director for
    Kroger.</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>In determining that Mr. Sargent is
independent, the Board considered transactions during fiscal 2015 between Kroger
and Staples, Inc. (where Mr. Sargent is Chairman and CEO) and determined that
the amount of business fell below the thresholds set by the NYSE listing
standards. The transactions involved the purchase of goods by Kroger in the
ordinary course of business totaling approximately $12 million and represented
less than 0.06% of Staples&#146; annual consolidated gross revenue. Kroger
periodically employs a bidding process or negotiations following a benchmarking
of costs of products from various vendors for the items purchased from Staples
and awards the business based on the results of that process.</FONT></P>
<P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial>11</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Audit Committee
Expertise</FONT></B></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>The Board has determined that Anne Gates,
Susan M. Phillips and Ronald L. Sargent, independent directors who are members
of the Audit Committee, are &#147;audit committee financial experts&#148; as defined by
applicable SEC regulations and that all members of the Audit Committee are
&#147;financially literate&#148; as that term is used in the NYSE listing standards and
are independent in accordance with Rule 10A-3 of the Securities Exchange Act of
1934.</FONT></P>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Code of Ethics</FONT></B></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>The Board has adopted </FONT><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>The Kroger Co. Policy on Business Ethics</FONT></I><FONT face=Arial size=2>, applicable to all officers, employees and directors,
including Kroger&#146;s principal executive, financial and accounting officers. The
</FONT><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Policy</FONT></I><FONT face=Arial size=2> is
available on our website at ir.kroger.com under Corporate Governance &#150;
Highlights. Shareholders may also obtain a copy of the </FONT><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Policy</FONT></I><FONT face=Arial size=2> by making a written
request to Kroger&#146;s Secretary at our executive offices.</FONT></P>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Communications with the
Board</FONT></B></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>The Board has established two separate
mechanisms for shareholders and interested parties to communicate with the
Board. Any shareholder or interested party who has concerns regarding
accounting, improper use of Kroger assets or ethical improprieties may report
these concerns via the toll-free hotline (800-689-4609) or email address
(helpline@kroger.com) established by the Board&#146;s Audit Committee. The concerns
are investigated by Kroger&#146;s Vice President of Auditing and reported to the
Audit Committee as deemed appropriate by the Vice President of
Auditing.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>Shareholders or interested parties also
may communicate with the Board in writing directed to Kroger&#146;s Secretary at our
executive offices. Communications relating to personnel issues or our ordinary
business operations, or seeking to do business with us, will be forwarded to the
business unit of Kroger that the Secretary deems appropriate. All other
communications will be forwarded to the chair of the Corporate Governance
Committee for further consideration. The chair of the Corporate Governance
Committee will take such action as he or she deems appropriate, which may
include referral to the full Corporate Governance Committee or the entire
Board.</FONT></P>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Attendance</FONT></B></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>The Board held five meetings in fiscal
year 2015. During fiscal year 2015, all incumbent directors attended at least
75% of the aggregate number of meetings of the Board and committees on which
that director served. Members of the Board are expected to use their best
efforts to attend all annual meetings of shareholders. All eleven members then
serving on the Board attended last year&#146;s annual meeting.</FONT></P>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Independent Compensation
Consultants</FONT></B></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>The Compensation Committee directly
engages a compensation consultant from Mercer Human Resource Consulting to
advise the Compensation Committee in the design of Kroger&#146;s executive
compensation. In 2015, Kroger paid that consultant $390,767 for work performed
for the Compensation Committee. Kroger, on management&#146;s recommendation, retained
the parent and affiliated companies of Mercer Human Resource Consulting to
provide other services for Kroger in 2015, for which Kroger paid $2,339,577.
These other services primarily related to insurance claims (for which Kroger was
reimbursed by insurance carriers as claims were adjusted), insurance brokerage
and bonding commissions provided by Marsh USA Inc., and pension plan compliance
and actuary services provided by Mercer Inc. Kroger also made payments to
affiliated companies for insurance premiums that were collected by the
affiliated companies on behalf of insurance carriers, but these amounts are not
included in the totals referenced above, as the amounts were paid over to
insurance carriers for services provided by those carriers. </FONT></P>
<P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial>12</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>Although neither the Compensation
Committee nor the Board expressly approved the other services, after taking into
consideration the NYSE&#146;s independence standards and the SEC rules, the
Compensation Committee determined that the consultant is independent and his
work has not raised any conflict of interest because:</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial>the consultant was first engaged by the
      Compensation Committee before he became associated</FONT> <FONT face=Arial size=2>with Mercer;</FONT> <BR>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial>the consultant works exclusively for the
      Compensation Committee and not for our management;</FONT> <BR>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial>the consultant does not benefit from the
      other work that Mercer&#146;s parent and affiliated companies</FONT> <FONT face=Arial size=2>perform for Kroger; and</FONT>
<BR>&nbsp;</TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%"><FONT face=Arial>neither the consultant nor the
      consultant&#146;s team perform any other services for
  Kroger.</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>The Compensation Committee may engage an
additional compensation consultant from time to time as it deems
advisable.</FONT></P>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Compensation Committee Interlocks and
Insider Participation</FONT></B></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>No member of the Compensation Committee
was an officer or employee of Kroger during fiscal 2015, and no member of the
Compensation Committee is a former officer of Kroger or was a party to any
disclosable related person transaction involving Kroger. During fiscal 2015,
none of our executive officers served on the board of directors or on the
compensation committee of any other entity that has or had executive officers
serving as a member of Kroger&#146;s Board of Directors or Compensation Committee of
the Board.</FONT></P>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Board Oversight of Enterprise
Risk</FONT></B></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>While risk management is primarily the
responsibility of Kroger&#146;s management team, the Board is responsible for
strategic planning and overall supervision of our risk management activities.
The Board&#146;s oversight of the material risks faced by Kroger occurs at both the
full Board level and at the committee level. </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>The Board receives presentations
throughout the year from various department and business unit leaders that
include discussion of significant risks as necessary. At each Board meeting, the
Chairman and CEO addresses matters of particular importance or concern,
including any significant areas of risk that require Board attention.
Additionally, through dedicated sessions focusing entirely on corporate
strategy, the full Board reviews in detail Kroger&#146;s short- and long-term
strategies, including consideration of significant risks facing Kroger and their
potential impact. The independent directors, in executive sessions led by the
Lead Director, address matters of particular concern, including significant
areas of risk, that warrant further discussion or consideration outside the
presence of Kroger employees. At the committee level, reports are given by
management subject matter experts to each committee on risks within the scope of
their charters. </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>The Audit Committee has oversight
responsibility not only for financial reporting of Kroger&#146;s major financial
exposures and the steps management has taken to monitor and control those
exposures, but also for the effectiveness of management&#146;s processes that monitor
and manage key business risks facing Kroger, as well as the major areas of risk
exposure and management&#146;s efforts to monitor and control that exposure. The
Audit Committee also discusses with management its policies with respect to risk
assessment and risk management.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>Management, including our Chief Ethics and
Compliance Officer, provides regular updates throughout the year to the
respective Board committees regarding management of the risks they oversee, and
each of these committees reports on risk to the full Board at each regular
meeting of the Board.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>We believe that our approach to risk
oversight, as described above, optimizes our ability to assess
inter-relationships among the various risks, make informed cost-benefit
decisions, and approach emerging risks in a proactive manner for Kroger. We also
believe that our risk structure complements our current Board leadership
structure, as it allows our independent directors, through the five fully
independent Board committees, and in executive sessions of independent directors
led by the Lead Director, to exercise effective oversight of the actions of
management, led by Mr. McMullen as Chairman of the Board and CEO, in identifying
risks and implementing effective risk management policies and
controls.</FONT></P>
<P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial>13</FONT></B></P>


<HR align=center width="100%" noshade SIZE=2>
<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<!-- C -->
<P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Compensation Discussion and
Analysis</FONT></B></P>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Executive Summary</FONT></B></P>
<P align=left><B><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Named Executive
Officers</FONT></I></B></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>This Compensation Discussion and Analysis
provides a discussion and analysis of our compensation program for our named
executive officers (&#147;NEOs&#148;). For the 2015 fiscal year ended January 30, 2016,
the NEOs were:</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="LINE-HEIGHT: 14pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR vAlign=bottom>
    <TD NOWRAP STYLE="text-align: center; width: 36%; background-color: #c0c0c0; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid"><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Name</FONT></B></TD>
    <TD noWrap style="text-align: center" width="1%" bgColor=#c0c0c0>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </TD>
    <TD NOWRAP STYLE="text-align: center; width: 62%; background-color: #c0c0c0; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid"><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Title</FONT></B></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=bottom>
    <TD noWrap align=left width="36%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>W. Rodney McMullen</FONT></TD>
    <TD noWrap align=left width="1%"></TD>
    <TD noWrap align=left width="62%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>Chairman and Chief Executive
    Officer</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=bottom>
    <TD noWrap align=left width="36%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>J. Michael Schlotman</FONT></TD>
    <TD noWrap align=left width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD noWrap align=left width="62%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>Executive Vice President and Chief Financial
      Officer</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=bottom>
    <TD noWrap align=left width="36%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>Michael J. Donnelly</FONT></TD>
    <TD noWrap align=left width="1%"></TD>
    <TD noWrap align=left width="62%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>Executive Vice President of
      Merchandising</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=bottom>
    <TD noWrap align=left width="36%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>Christopher T. Hjelm</FONT></TD>
    <TD noWrap align=left width="1%"></TD>
    <TD noWrap align=left width="62%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>Executive Vice President and Chief
      Information Officer</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=bottom>
    <TD noWrap align=left width="36%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>Frederick J. Morganthall II</FONT></TD>
    <TD noWrap align=left width="1%"></TD>
    <TD noWrap align=left width="62%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>Executive Vice President of Retail
      Operations</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE><BR>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>Messrs. Schlotman, Donnelly, Hjelm and
Morganthall were each promoted to the position of Executive Vice President
effective September 1, 2015.</FONT></P>
<P align=left><B><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Executive Compensation in Context:
Our Growth Plan, Financial Strategy and Fiscal Year 2015
Results</FONT></I></B></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>Kroger&#146;s growth plan includes four key
performance indicators: positive identical supermarket sales without fuel (&#147;ID
Sales&#148;) growth, slightly expanding non-fuel first in, first out (&#147;FIFO&#148;)
operating margin, growing return on invested capital (&#147;ROIC&#148;), and annual market
share growth. In 2015, we met or exceeded our goals for each of these
performance indicators:</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial><EM>ID Sales. </EM><FONT size=2 face="Arial">ID Sales increased 5.0% from 2014. Through 2015, we have achieved
      49 consecutive</FONT></FONT> <FONT face=Arial size=2>quarters of positive
      ID Sales growth.<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial><EM>ROIC. </EM><FONT size=2 face="Arial">Our ROIC for 2015 was 13.93%, compared to 13.76% for 2014,
      excluding Roundy&#146;s (acquired</FONT></FONT> <FONT face=Arial size=2>in
      December 2015).<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial><EM>Non-Fuel FIFO Operating
      Margin. </EM><FONT size=2 face="Arial">We exceeded our commitment to slightly expand
      FIFO operating</FONT></FONT> <FONT face=Arial size=2>margin, excluding
      fuel and Roundy&#146;s on a rolling four quarters basis.<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial><EM>Market
      Share. </EM><FONT size=2 face="Arial">Our market share grew for an eleventh consecutive
      year.<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top width="1%"></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial>Other highlights
      of the year include:<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial>Net earnings per
      diluted share were $2.06.<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial>We exceeded our
      long-term, net earnings per diluted share growth rate of 8-11% in
      2015.<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial>We reduced
      operating costs excluding fuel as a percentage of sales for the eleventh
      consecutive year.<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top width="1%"></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial>Also during
      2015, we met all of our objectives with regard to our financial
      strategy:<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial><EM>Maintain our
      current investment grade debt rating. </EM><FONT size=2 face="Arial">Our net total debt
      to adjusted EBITDA ratio</FONT></FONT> <FONT face=Arial size=2>decreased,
      even while investing approximately $870 million in our merger with
      Roundy&#146;s late in</FONT> <FONT face=Arial size=2>the
    year.<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial><EM>Repurchase
      shares</EM><FONT size=2 face="Arial">. In 2015, we repurchased $703 million in Kroger
      common shares.<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial><EM>Fund the
      dividend</EM><FONT size=2 face="Arial">. We returned $385 million to shareholders
      through our dividend in 2015, and we</FONT></FONT> <FONT face=Arial size=2>increased our dividend for the ninth consecutive year since we
      reinstated our dividend in 2006.<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial><EM>Increase
      capital investments</EM><FONT size=2 face="Arial">. Our 2015 cash flow generation was
      strong, allowing us to make</FONT></FONT> <FONT face=Arial size=2>$3.3
      billion in capital investments during the year, excluding mergers,
      acquisitions and purchases of</FONT> <FONT face=Arial size=2>leased
      facilities.</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR><TD></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>The compensation of our NEOs in 2015 reflects
Kroger&#146;s short-term and long-term goals and outcomes. Total compensation for the
year is an indicator of how well Kroger performed compared to our business plan,
reflecting how our compensation program responds to business challenges and the
marketplace.</FONT></P>

<P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial>14</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<P align=left><B><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Summary of Key Compensation
Practices</FONT></I></B></P>
<TABLE style="LINE-HEIGHT: normal; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR vAlign=bottom>
    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; text-align: center; width: 44%; background-color: #c0c0c0; padding-right: 2pt; padding-left: 2pt"><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>What we do:</FONT></B></TD>
    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; text-align: center; width: 55%; background-color: #c0c0c0; padding-right: 2pt; padding-left: 2pt"><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>What we do not
  do:</FONT></B></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD STYLE="border-right: #000000 1pt solid; border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: top; text-align: left; width: 44%; padding-right: 2pt; padding-left: 2pt">
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left; padding-bottom:8pt"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 5pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#10003;</FONT><FONT size=2 face="Arial"><FONT face=Arial><FONT size=2 face="Arial">Align pay and
      performance</FONT></FONT></FONT></DIV>
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left; padding-bottom:8pt"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 5pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#10003;</FONT><FONT size=2 face="Arial"><FONT face=Arial><FONT size=2 face="Arial">Significant share ownership guidelines of 5x
      salary for our CEO</FONT></FONT></FONT></DIV>
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left; padding-bottom:8pt"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 5pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#10003;</FONT><FONT size=2 face="Arial"><FONT face=Arial><FONT size=2 face="Arial">Multiple performance metrics under our short- and
      long-term performance-based plans discourage excessive risk
      taking</FONT></FONT></FONT></DIV>
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left; padding-bottom:8pt"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 5pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#10003;</FONT><FONT size=2 face="Arial"><FONT face=Arial>Balance between short-term and long-term compensation
      discourages short-term risk taking at the expense of long-term
      results</FONT></FONT></DIV>
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left; padding-bottom:8pt"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 5pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#10003;</FONT><FONT size=2 face="Arial"><FONT face=Arial>Engagement of an independent compensation
      consultant</FONT></FONT></DIV>
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left; padding-bottom:8pt"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 5pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#10003;</FONT><FONT size=2 face="Arial"><FONT face=Arial>Robust clawback policy</FONT></FONT></DIV>
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left; padding-bottom:8pt"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 5pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#10003;</FONT><FONT size=2 face="Arial"><FONT face=Arial>Ban on hedging and pledging of Kroger
      securities</FONT></FONT></DIV>
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 5pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#10003;</FONT><FONT size=2 face="Arial"><FONT face=Arial>Limited perquisites</FONT></FONT></DIV></TD>
    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: top; text-align: left; width: 55%; padding-right: 2pt; padding-left: 2pt">
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left; padding-bottom:8pt"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt" face=Arial>&#215;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2>No employment contracts with executives</FONT></DIV>
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left; padding-bottom:8pt"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt" face=Arial>&#215;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2>No special severance or change of control programs applicable only
      to executive officers</FONT></DIV>
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left; padding-bottom:8pt"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt" face=Arial>&#215;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2>No gross-up payments were made to executives under Kroger
      plans</FONT></DIV>
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left; padding-bottom:8pt"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt" face=Arial>&#215;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2>No re-pricing or backdating of options</FONT></DIV>
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left; padding-bottom:8pt"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt" face=Arial>&#215;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2>No guaranteed salary increases or bonuses</FONT></DIV>
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left; padding-bottom:8pt"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt" face=Arial>&#215;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2>No payment of dividends or dividend equivalents until performance
      units are earned</FONT></DIV>
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt" face=Arial>&#215;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2><FONT face=Arial size=2>No single-trigger cash severance benefits
      upon a change in control</FONT></FONT></DIV></TD></TR></TABLE><BR>
<P align=left><B><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Summary of Fixed and At-Risk Pay
Elements</FONT></I></B></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>The fixed and at-risk pay elements of NEO
compensation are reflected in the following table and charts. The amounts used
in the charts are based on the amounts reported in the Summary Compensation
Table for 2015, excluding the Change in Pension Value and Nonqualified Deferred
Compensation Earnings column.</FONT></P>

    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: top; text-align: center; width: 17%; background-color: #c0c0c0; padding-right: 2pt; padding-left: 2pt">
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2>Fixed cash compensation</FONT></DIV>
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2>Reviewed annually</FONT></DIV>
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2>No automatic or guaranteed increases</FONT></DIV></TD>
    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: top; text-align: center; width: 19%; background-color: #c0c0c0; padding-right: 2pt; padding-left: 2pt">
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2>Insurance premiums paid by the Company</FONT></DIV>
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2>Dividends paid on unvested restricted stock</FONT></DIV>
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2>Matching and automatic contributions to defined contribution
      benefit plans</FONT></DIV></TD>
    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: top; text-align: center; width: 15%; padding-right: 2pt; padding-left: 2pt">
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2>Variable cash compensation</FONT></DIV>
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2>Payout depends on actual performance against annually established
      goals</FONT></DIV></TD>
    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: top; text-align: center; width: 20%; padding-right: 2pt; padding-left: 2pt">
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2>Variable compensation payable as long-term cash bonus and
      performance units</FONT></DIV>
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2>3-year performance period</FONT></DIV>
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face="Arial" size=2><FONT face=Arial size=2>Payout depends on
      actual performance against established goals</FONT></FONT></DIV></TD>
    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: top; text-align: center; width: 17%; padding-right: 2pt; padding-left: 2pt">
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face="Arial" size=2><FONT face=Arial>Stock options vest over 5
      years</FONT></FONT></DIV>
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face="Arial" size=2><FONT face=Arial>Exercise price of stock
      options is closing price on day of grant</FONT></FONT></DIV>
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face="Arial" size=2><FONT face=Arial size=2>Restricted stock
      vests over 3 or 5 years</FONT></FONT></DIV></TD></TR></TABLE><BR>
<P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial>15</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<TABLE style="LINE-HEIGHT: normal; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR vAlign=bottom>
    <TD STYLE="text-align: center; width: 11%"></TD>
    <TD COLSPAN="2" STYLE="text-align: center; width: 36%; background-color: #c0c0c0"><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Fixed</FONT></B></TD>
    <TD STYLE="text-align: center; width: 15%"></TD>
    <TD STYLE="text-align: center; width: 20%"><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>At-Risk</FONT></B></TD>

    <TD STYLE="text-align: center; width: 11%"></TD>

      &#151;&#151;&#151;&#151;</FONT></STRONG></TD>
    <TD STYLE="text-align: left; width: 15%"><STRONG><FONT face=Arial size=2>&#151;&#151;&#151;&#151;&#151;&#151;&#151;&#155;</FONT></STRONG></TD>
    <TD COLSPAN="2" STYLE="text-align: center; width: 37%"><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>&#139;&#151;&#151;&#151;&#151;&#151;&#151;&nbsp;Long-Term &#151;&#151;&#151;&#151;&#151;&#151;&#155;</FONT></B></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; text-align: center; width: 11%"></TD>
    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; text-align: center; width: 17%; background-color: #c0c0c0"></TD>
    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; text-align: center; width: 19%; background-color: #c0c0c0">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; text-align: center; width: 15%"></TD>
    <TD COLSPAN="2" STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; text-align: center; width: 37%"></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: top; text-align: center; width: 11%; padding-right: 2pt; padding-left: 2pt">
      <P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Purpose</FONT></B></P></TD>
    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: top; text-align: center; width: 17%; background-color: #c0c0c0; padding-right: 2pt; padding-left: 2pt">
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2>Provide a base level of cash compensation</FONT></DIV>
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2>Recognize individual performance, scope of responsibility and
      experience</FONT></DIV></TD>
    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: top; text-align: center; width: 19%; background-color: #c0c0c0; padding-right: 2pt; padding-left: 2pt">
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2>Provide benefits competitive with peers</FONT></DIV></TD>
    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: top; text-align: center; width: 15%; padding-right: 2pt; padding-left: 2pt">
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2>Metrics and targets align with annual business goals</FONT></DIV>
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2>Rewards and incentivizes approximately 13,000 Kroger employees,
      including NEOs, for annual performance on key financial and operational
      measures</FONT></DIV></TD>
    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: top; text-align: center; width: 20%; padding-right: 2pt; padding-left: 2pt">
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2>Metrics and targets align with long-term business
      strategy</FONT></DIV>
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2>Rewards and incentivizes approximately 160 key employees, including
      the NEOs, for long-term performance on key financial and operational
      measures</FONT></DIV>
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face="Arial" size=2><FONT face=Arial size=2>Drives sustainable
      performance that ties to long-term value creation for
      shareholders</FONT></FONT></DIV></TD>
    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: top; text-align: center; width: 17%; padding-right: 2pt; padding-left: 2pt">
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face="Arial" size=2><FONT face=Arial>Retain executive
      talent</FONT></FONT></DIV>
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face="Arial" size=2><FONT face=Arial>Align the interests of
      executives with long-term shareholder value</FONT></FONT></DIV>
      <DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: -14.5pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><FONT style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT face="Arial" size=2><FONT face=Arial size=2>Provide direct
      alignment to stock price
appreciation</FONT></FONT></DIV></TD></TR></TABLE><BR>

<TABLE cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top align=center width="49%">
      <P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>CEO</FONT></B></P>
      <P><IMG src="kroger_def14a3x3x2.jpg" border=0></P>

  <TR>

    <TD vAlign=top width="49%">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top align=center width="49%">

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>

<TABLE cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top align=center width="49%">
      <P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>CEO</FONT></B></P>
      <P align=center><IMG src="kroger_def14a3x4x1.jpg" border=0></P>
      <P align=center><FONT face=Arial size=2>60% of CEO pay is
    Equity</FONT></P></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top align=center width="1%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </TD>
    <TD vAlign=top align=center width="49%">
      <P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Average of Other
      NEOs</FONT></B></P>
      <P align=center><IMG src="kroger_def14a3x4x2.jpg" border=0></P>
      <P align=center><FONT face=Arial size=2>55% of Other NEO pay is
      Equity</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>The following discussion and analysis
addresses the compensation of the NEOs and the factors considered by the
Compensation Committee in setting compensation for the NEOs and, in the case of
the CEO&#146;s compensation, making recommendations to the independent directors.
Additional detail is provided in the compensation tables and the accompanying
narrative disclosures that follow this discussion and analysis.</FONT></P>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Our Compensation Philosophy and
Objectives</FONT></B></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>As one of the largest retailers in the
world, our executive compensation philosophy is to attract and retain the best
management talent and to motivate these employees to achieve our business and
financial goals. Kroger&#146;s incentive plans are designed to reward the actions
that lead to long-term value creation. The Compensation Committee believes that
there is a strong link between our business strategy, the performance metrics in
our short-term and long-term incentive programs, and the business results that
drive shareholder value.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>We believe our strategy creates value for
shareholders in a manner consistent with our focus on our core values: honesty,
integrity, respect, inclusion, diversity and safety.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>To achieve our objectives, the
Compensation Committee seeks to ensure that compensation is competitive and that
there is a direct link between pay and performance. To do so, it is guided by
the following principles:</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>A significant portion of pay should
      be performance-based, with the percentage of total pay tied to performance
      increasing proportionally with an executive&#146;s level of
      responsibility.<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Compensation should include
      incentive-based pay to drive performance, providing superior pay for
      superior performance, including both a short- and long-term
      focus.<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Compensation policies should include
      an opportunity for, and a requirement of, equity ownership to align the
      interests of executives and shareholders.<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Components of compensation should be
      tied to an evaluation of business and individual performance measured
      against metrics that directly drive our business strategy.</FONT></P>
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>The
      Compensation Committee has three related objectives regarding
      compensation: <BR>&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>First, the Compensation Committee
      believes that compensation must be designed to attract and retain those
      best suited to fulfill the challenging roles that officers play at Kroger.
      <BR>&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Second, a majority of compensation
      should help align the interests of our officers with the interests of our
      shareholders. <BR>&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Third, compensation should create
      strong incentives for the officers to achieve the annual business plan
      targets established by the Board, and to achieve Kroger&#146;s long-term
      strategic objectives. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial>17</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Components of Executive Compensation at
Kroger</FONT></B></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>Compensation for our NEOs is comprised of
the following:</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="100%" colSpan=2><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
      <FONT face=Arial size=2>Annual Compensation:<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 30pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#10146;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%"><FONT face=Arial>Salary<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 30pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#10146;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%"><FONT face=Arial>Performance-Based Annual Cash
      Bonus<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="100%" colSpan=2><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
      <FONT face=Arial>Long-Term Compensation:<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 30pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#10146;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%"><FONT face=Arial>Performance-Based Long-Term
      Incentive Plan (consisting of a long-term cash bonus and</FONT> <FONT face=Arial size=2>performance units)<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 30pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#10146;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%"><FONT face=Arial>Non-qualified stock
      options<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 30pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#10146;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%"><FONT face=Arial>Restricted
      stock<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="100%" colSpan=2>
      <P><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <FONT face=Arial>Retirement and other benefits</FONT></P>
      <P><FONT face=Arial><FONT face="Arial">&#9679;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
      </FONT><FONT face=Arial>Limited
perquisites</FONT></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>The annual and long-term performance-based
compensation awards described herein were made pursuant to our 2011 Long-Term
Incentive and Cash Bonus Plan and our 2014 Long-Term Incentive and Cash Bonus
Plan, each of which was approved by our shareholders in 2011 and 2014,
respectively.</FONT></P>
<P align=left><B><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Annual Compensation &#150;
Salary</FONT></I></B></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>Our philosophy with respect to salary is
to provide a sufficient and stable source of fixed cash compensation. All of our
compensation cannot be at-risk or long-term. It is important to provide a
meaningful annual salary to attract and retain a high caliber leadership team,
and to have an appropriate level of cash compensation that is not variable.
</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>Salaries for the NEOs (with the exception
of the CEO) are established each year by the Compensation Committee, in
consultation with the CEO. The CEO&#146;s salary is established by the independent
directors. Salaries for the NEOs are reviewed annually in June.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>The amount of each NEO&#146;s salary is
influenced by numerous factors including:</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%"><FONT face=Arial>An assessment of individual
      contribution in the judgment of the CEO and the Compensation</FONT> <FONT face=Arial size=2>Committee (or, in the case of the CEO, of the
      Compensation Committee and the rest of the</FONT> <FONT face=Arial size=2>independent directors);<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%"><FONT face=Arial>Benchmarking with comparable
      positions at peer group companies;<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%"><FONT face=Arial>Tenure in role;
      and<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%"><FONT face=Arial>Relationship to
      other Kroger executives&#146; salaries.</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>The assessment of individual contribution is a
qualitative determination, based on the following factors:</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%"><FONT face=Arial>Leadership;</FONT>
    <BR>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%"><FONT face=Arial>Contribution to the officer
      group;<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%"><FONT face=Arial>Achievement of established
      objectives, to the extent applicable;<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%"><FONT face=Arial>Decision-making
      abilities;<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%"><FONT face=Arial>Performance of
      the areas or groups directly reporting to the
  officer;<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%"><FONT face=Arial>Increased
      responsibilities;<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%"><FONT face=Arial>Strategic
      thinking; and<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>

    <TD vAlign=top width="99%"><FONT face=Arial>Furtherance of
      Kroger&#146;s core values.</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>

<P align=left><B><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Annual Compensation &#150;
Performance-Based Annual Cash Bonus</FONT></I></B></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>The NEOs, along with approximately 13,000
of their fellow Kroger associates, participate in a performance-based annual
cash bonus plan. Approximately 7,000 of those associates are eligible for the
same plan as the NEOs. The remaining associates are eligible for an annual cash
bonus plan of which 40% is based on the Kroger corporate plan and 60% is based
on the metrics and targets for their respective supermarket division or
operating unit of the Company. </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>Over time, the Compensation Committee and
our independent directors have placed an increased emphasis on our strategic
plan by making the targets more difficult to achieve. The annual cash bonus plan
is structured to encourage high levels of performance. A threshold level of
performance must be achieved before any payouts are earned, while a payout of up
to 200% of target can be achieved for superior performance.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>The amount of annual cash bonus that the
NEOs earn each year is based upon Kroger&#146;s performance compared to targets
established by the Compensation Committee and the independent directors based on
the business plan adopted by the Board of Directors. </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>The annual cash bonus plan is designed to
encourage decisions and behavior that drive the annual operating results and the
long-term success of the Company. Kroger&#146;s success is based on a combination of
factors, and accordingly the Compensation Committee believes that it is
important to encourage behavior that supports multiple elements of our business
strategy. </FONT></P>
<P align=left><B><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Establishing Annual Cash Bonus
Potentials</FONT></I></B></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>The Compensation Committee establishes
annual cash bonus potentials for each NEO, other than the CEO, whose annual cash
bonus potential is established by the independent directors. Actual payouts,
which can exceed 100% of the potential amounts but may not exceed 200% of the
potential amounts, represent the extent to which performance meets or exceeds
the goals established by the Compensation Committee. Actual payouts may be as
low as zero if performance does not meet the goals established by the
Compensation Committee.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>The Compensation Committee considers
multiple factors in making its determination or recommendation as to annual cash
bonus potentials:</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%"><FONT face=Arial>The individual&#146;s level within
      the organization, as the Compensation Committee believes that more</FONT>
      <FONT face=Arial size=2>senior executives should have a more substantial
      part of their compensation dependent upon</FONT> <FONT face=Arial size=2>Kroger&#146;s performance;<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%"><FONT face=Arial>The individual&#146;s salary, as
      the Compensation Committee believes that a significant portion of a</FONT>
      <FONT face=Arial size=2>NEO&#146;s total cash compensation should be dependent
      upon Kroger&#146;s performance;</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial>19</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

      performance;<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
