<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LINE-HEIGHT: normal; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt" vAlign=top noWrap><FONT face=Arial size=2>(1)</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="100%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>These amounts relate
      to the 2015 performance-based annual cash bonus plan. The amount listed
      under &#147;Target&#148; represents the annual cash bonus potential of the NEO. By
      the terms of the plan, payouts are limited to no more than 200% of a
      participant&#146;s annual cash bonus potential; accordingly, the amount listed
      under &#147;Maximum&#148; equals two times that officer&#146;s annual cash bonus
      potential amount. In the event that a participant&#146;s annual cash bonus
      potential is increased during the year following the annual compensation
      review and/or a promotion, the target and maximum amounts are prorated to
      reflect the increase. Accordingly, the amounts reported for each NEO
      reflect the prorated targets and maximums. The amounts actually earned
      under this plan were paid in March 2016 and are included in the Summary
      Compensation Table for 2015 in the &#147;Non-Equity Incentive Plan
      Compensation&#148; column and are described in footnote 4 to that
    table.</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial>37</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LINE-HEIGHT: normal; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt" vAlign=top noWrap><FONT face=Arial size=2>(2)</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="100%" colSpan=2><FONT face=Arial size=2>These
      amounts relate to the long-term cash bonus potential issued under 2015
      Long-Term Incentive Plan, which covers performance during fiscal years
      2015, 2016 and 2017. The long-term cash bonus potential amount equals the
      annual base salary of the NEOs as of the last day of fiscal 2014 (or date
      of plan entry, if later). By the terms of the plan, payouts are limited to
      no more than 100% of a participant&#146;s long-term cash bonus potential;
      accordingly, the amount listed under &#147;Maximum&#148; equals the participant&#146;s
      long-term cash bonus potential. Because the actual payout is based on the
      level of performance achieved, the target amount is not determinable and
      therefore the amount listed under &#147;Target&#148; is a representative amount
      based on the probable outcome of the performance conditions.</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt" vAlign=top noWrap><FONT face=Arial size=2>(3)</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="100%" colSpan=2><FONT face=Arial size=2>These
      amounts represent performance units awarded under the 2015 Long-Term
      Incentive Plan, which covers performance during fiscal years 2015, 2016
      and 2017. The amount listed under &#147;Maximum&#148; represents the maximum number
      of common shares that can be earned by the NEO under the award. Because
      the actual payout is based on the level of performance achieved, the
      target amount is not determinable and therefore the amount listed under
      &#147;Target&#148; reflects a representative amount based on the probable outcome of
      the performance conditions. The grant date fair value reported in the last
      column is based on the probable outcome of the performance conditions as
      of the grant date. This amount is consistent with the estimate of
      aggregate compensation cost to be recognized by the Company over the
      three-year performance period of the award determined as of the grant date
      under FASB ASC Topic 718, excluding the effect of estimated forfeitures.
      The aggregate grant date fair value of these awards is included in the
      Summary Compensation Table for 2015 in the &#147;Stock Awards&#148; column and
      described in footnote 2 to that table.</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt" vAlign=top noWrap><FONT face=Arial size=2>(4)</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="100%" colSpan=2><FONT face=Arial size=2>These
      amounts represent the number of shares of restricted stock granted in
      2015. The aggregate grant date fair value reported in the last column is
      calculated in accordance with FASB ASC Topic 718. The aggregate grant date
      fair value of these awards is included in the Summary Compensation Table
      for 2015 in the &#147;Stock Awards&#148; column and described in footnote 2 to that
      table.&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="100%" colSpan=2><FONT face=Arial size=2></FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT face=Arial size=2>(5)</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="100%" colSpan=2><FONT face=Arial size=2>These
      amounts represent the number of stock options granted in 2015. Options are
      granted with an exercise price equal to the closing price of Kroger common
      shares on the grant date. The aggregate grant date fair value reported in
      the last column is calculated in accordance with FASB ASC Topic 718. The
      aggregate grant date fair value of these awards is included in the Summary
      Compensation Table for 2015 in the &#147;Option Awards&#148;
  column.</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>The Compensation
Committee, and the independent members of the Board in the case of the CEO,
established the bonus potentials shown in this table as &#147;Target&#148; amounts for the
performance-based annual cash bonus awards, and established the amounts shown in
this table as &#147;Maximum&#148; amounts for the long-term cash bonus awards and the
performance unit awards. Amounts are payable to the extent that performance
meets specific performance goals established by the Compensation Committee at
the beginning of the performance period. As described in the Compensation
Discussion and Analysis, actual earnings under the annual performance-based cash
bonus plan may exceed the target amount if the Company&#146;s performance exceeds the
performance goals, but are limited to 200% of the target amount. The
Compensation Committee, and the independent members of the Board in the case of
the CEO, also determined the number of performance units to be awarded to each
NEO, under which common shares are earned to the extent performance meets
specific objectives established at the beginning of the performance period. The
performance units and the long-term cash bonus awards are more particularly
described in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Restrictions on
restricted stock awarded to the NEOs normally lapse, so long as the officer is
then in our employ, in equal amounts on each of the first five anniversaries of
the grant date, except that the awards granted to Messrs. Schlotman, Donnelly,
Hjelm and Morganthall on 9/17/2015 and 9,132 shares of the award granted to Mr.
Morganthall on 7/15/15 vest in equal amounts on each of the first three
anniversaries of the grant date. Any dividends declared on Kroger common shares
are payable on unvested restricted stock. Nonqualified stock options granted to
the NEOs normally vest, so long as the officer is then in our employ, in equal
amounts on each of the first five anniversaries of the grant date. </FONT></P>
<P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial>38</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>2015 Outstanding Equity Awards at
Fiscal Year-End</FONT></B></P>

awards for the NEOs as of the end of 2015. The vesting schedule for each award
is described in the footnotes to this table. The market value of unvested
restricted stock and unearned performance units is based on the closing price of
Kroger&#146;s common shares of $38.81 on January 29, 2016, the last trading day of
2015.</FONT></P>

<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>2015 Option Exercises and Stock
Vested</FONT></B></P>

<P align=left><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Restricted stock</FONT></I><FONT face=Arial size=2>. The table includes the number of shares acquired upon
vesting of restricted stock and the value realized on the vesting of restricted
stock.</FONT></P>
<P align=left><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Performance Units</FONT></I><FONT face=Arial size=2>. In 2013, participants in the 2013 Long-Term Incentive Plan
were awarded performance units that were earned based on performance criteria
established by the Compensation Committee at the beginning of the three-year
performance period. Actual payouts were based on the level of performance
achieved, and were paid in common shares. The number of common shares issued and
the value realized based on the closing price of Kroger common shares of $37.73
on March 10, 2016, the date of deemed delivery of the shares, are reflected in
the table above.</FONT></P></DIV>

    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt" vAlign=top noWrap><FONT face=Arial size=2>(1)</FONT></TD>
    <TD width="100%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>The discount rate used to
      determine the present values was 4.66% for the Kroger and Dillon plans,
      4.65% for the Harris Teeter Supermarkets, Inc. Employees&#146; Pension Plan
      (the &#147;HT Pension Plan&#148;) and 4.40% for the Harris Teeter Supermarkets, Inc.
      Supplemental Executive Retirement Plan (the &#147;HT SERP&#148;), which are the same
      rates used at the measurement date for financial reporting purposes.
      Additional assumptions used in calculating the present values are set
      forth in Note 15 to the consolidated financial statements in Kroger&#146;s 10-K
      for 2015.</FONT></TD></TR>

<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><B><FONT face=Arial>41</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<P align=left><B><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Kroger Pension Plan and Excess
Plan</FONT></I></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Messrs.
McMullen, Schlotman, Donnelly and Hjelm participate in The Kroger Consolidated
Retirement Benefit Plan (the &#147;Kroger Pension Plan&#148;), which is a qualified
defined benefit pension plan. Messrs. McMullen, Schlotman and Donnelly also
participate in The Kroger Co. Excess Benefit Plan (the &#147;Excess Plan&#148;), which is
a nonqualified deferred compensation plan as defined in Section 409A of the
Internal Revenue Code. The purpose of the Excess Plan is to make up the
shortfall in retirement benefits caused by the limitations on benefits to highly
compensated individuals under the qualified defined benefit pension plans in
accordance with the Internal Revenue Code.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Although
participants generally receive credited service beginning at age 21, certain
participants in the Kroger Pension Plan and the Excess Plan who commenced
employment prior to 1986, including Messrs. McMullen and Schlotman, began to
accrue credited service after attaining age 25 and one year of service. The
Kroger Pension Plan and the Excess Plan generally determine accrued benefits
using a cash balance formula, but retain benefit formulas applicable under prior
plans for certain &#147;grandfathered participants&#148; who were employed by Kroger on
December 31, 2000. Each of Messrs. McMullen, Schlotman and Donnelly is eligible
for these grandfathered benefits. Mr. Hjelm is not a grandfathered participant,
and therefore, his benefits are determined using the cash balance
formula.</FONT></P>
<P align=left><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Grandfathered
Participants</FONT></I></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Benefits for
grandfathered participants are determined using formulas applicable under prior
plans, including the Kroger formula covering service to The Kroger Co. and the
Dillon formula covering service to Dillon Companies, Inc. As &#147;grandfathered
participants&#148;, Messrs. McMullen, Schlotman and Donnelly will receive benefits
under the Kroger Pension Plan and the Excess Plan, determined as
follows:</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; TEXT-ALIGN: left" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>1&#189;% times years of credited service
      multiplied by the average of the highest five years of total earnings
      (base salary and annual cash bonus) during the last ten calendar years of
      employment, reduced by 1&#188;% times years of credited service multiplied by
      the primary social security benefit;<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>normal retirement age is 65;
      <BR>&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>unreduced benefits are payable
      beginning at age 62; and <BR>&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>benefits payable between ages 55 and
      62 will be reduced by </FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2></FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2>&#8531; of one percent for each of the first 24 months and by &#189;
      of one percent for each of the next 60 months by which the commencement of
      benefits precedes age 62.</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>In the event of
a termination of employment other than death or disability, Messrs. McMullen,
Schlotman and Donnelly currently are eligible for a reduced early retirement
benefit, as each has attained age 55. If a &#147;grandfathered participant&#148; becomes
disabled while employed by Kroger and after attaining age 55, the participant
will receive the full retirement benefit. If a married &#147;grandfathered
participant&#148; dies while employed by Kroger, the surviving spouse will receive
benefits as though a retirement occurred on such date, based on the greater of:
actual benefits payable to the participant if he was over age 55, or the
benefits that would have been payable to the participant assuming he was age 55
on the date of death.</FONT></P>
<P align=left><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Cash Balance
Participants</FONT></I></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Mr. Hjelm began
participating in the Kroger Pension Plan in August 2005 as a cash balance
participant. Until the plan was frozen on December 31, 2006, cash balance
participants received an annual pay credit equal to 5% of that year&#146;s eligible
earnings plus an annual interest credit equal to the account balance at the
beginning of the plan year multiplied by the annual rate of interest on 30-year
Treasury Securities in effect prior to the plan year. Beginning on January 1,
2007, cash balance participants receive an annual interest credit but no longer
receive an annual pay credit. Upon retirement, cash balance participants
generally are eligible to receive a life annuity which is the actuarial
equivalent of his account balance, but may elect in some circumstances to
receive a lump sum distribution equal to his account balance. If Mr. Hjelm
becomes disabled while employed by Kroger, he will receive the full retirement
benefit. If he dies while employed by Kroger, his beneficiary will receive a
death benefit equal to the benefit he was eligible to receive if a retirement
occurred on such date.</FONT></P>
<P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial>42</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<P align=left><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Offsetting Benefits</FONT></I></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Mr. Donnelly
also participates in the Dillon Companies, Inc. Employees&#146; Profit Sharing Plan,
which is a qualified defined contribution plan (the &#147;Dillon Profit Sharing
Plan&#148;) under which Dillon Companies, Inc. and its participating subsidiaries may
choose to make discretionary contributions each year that are allocated to each
participant&#146;s account. Participation in Dillon Profit Sharing Plan was frozen in
2001 and participants are no longer able to make employee contributions, but
certain participants, including Mr. Donnelly, are still eligible for employer
contributions. Participants elect from among a number of investment options and
the amounts in their accounts are invested and credited with investment earnings
in accordance with their elections. Due to offset formulas contained in the
Kroger Pension Plan, Mr. Donnelly&#146;s accrued benefits under the Dillon Profit
Sharing Plan offset a portion of the benefit that would otherwise accrue for him
under the Kroger Pension for his service with Dillon Companies, Inc. This offset
is reflected in the table above.</FONT></P>
<P align=left><B><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Harris Teeter Pension
Plan</FONT></I></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Mr. Morganthall
participates in the HT Pension Plan, which is a defined benefit pension plan.
Participation in the HT Pension Plan was frozen effective October 1, 2005. For
participants with age and service points as of December 31, 2005 equal to or
greater than 45, which includes Mr. Morganthall, benefit accruals under the HT
Pension Plan after September 30, 2005 will be offset by the actuarial equivalent
of the portion of their account balance under the Harris Teeter Supermarkets,
Inc. Retirement and Savings Plan (the &#147;HT Savings Plan&#148;) that are attributable
to automatic retirement contributions made by Harris Teeter after September 30,
2005, plus earnings and losses on such contributions. A participant&#146;s normal
annual retirement benefit under the HT Pension Plan at age 65 is an amount equal
to 0.8% of his final average earnings multiplied by years of service at
retirement, plus 0.6% of his final average earnings in excess of Social Security
covered compensation multiplied by the number of years of service up to a
maximum of 35 years. A participant&#146;s final average earnings is the average
annual cash compensation paid to the participant during the plan year, including
salary, incentive compensation and any amount contributed to the HT Savings
Plan, for the 5 consecutive years in the last 10 years that produce the highest
average.</FONT></P>
<P align=left><B><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Harris Teeter
SERP</FONT></I></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Mr. Morganthall
also participates in the HT SERP, which is a nonqualified deferred compensation
plan as defined in Section 409A of the Internal Revenue Code. The purpose of the
HT SERP is to supplement the benefits payable under the retirement plans. Under
the HT SERP, participants who retire at normal retirement age of 60 receive
monthly retirement benefits equal to between 55% and 60% of his final average
earnings times his accrual fraction and reduced by his (1) assumed HT Pension
Plan retirement benefit, and (2) assumed Social Security benefit. The final
average earnings are the average annual earnings during the highest 3 calendar
years out of the last 10 calendar years preceding termination of employment. The
accrual fraction is a fraction, the numerator of which is the years of credited
service, the denominator of which is 20, and which may not exceed 1.0. The
benefits payable under the HT SERP are payable for the participant&#146;s lifetime
with an automatic 75% survivor benefit payable to the participant&#146;s surviving
eligible spouse for his or her lifetime. Mr. Morganthall is eligible to receive
the full benefit as he has reached age 60. Harris Teeter uses a non-qualified
trust to purchase and hold the assets to satisfy Harris Teeter&#146;s obligation
under the HT SERP, and participants in the HT SERP are general creditors of
Harris Teeter in the event Harris Teeter becomes insolvent.</FONT></P>
<P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial>43</FONT></B></P>


<HR align=center width="100%" noshade SIZE=2>

    <TD noWrap align=left width="1%" bgColor=#c0c0c0><FONT face=Arial size=2><SUP>(3)</SUP></FONT></TD>

    <TD noWrap align=right width="1%" bgColor=#c0c0c0>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;

<P align=left><B><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Kroger Executive Deferred
Compensation Plan</FONT></I></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Messrs.
McMullen, Donnelly and Hjelm participate in The Kroger Co. Executive Deferred
Compensation Plan, which is a nonqualified deferred compensation plan.
Participants may elect to defer up to 100% of the amount of their salary that
exceeds the sum of the FICA wage base and pre-tax insurance and other Internal
Revenue Code Section 125 plan deductions, as well as up to 100% of their annual
and long-term cash bonus compensation. Kroger does not match any deferral or
provide other contributions. Deferral account amounts are credited with interest
at the rate representing Kroger&#146;s cost of ten-year debt as determined by
Kroger&#146;s CEO and approved by the Compensation Committee prior to the beginning
of each deferral year. The interest rate established for deferral amounts for
each deferral year will be applied to those deferral amounts for all subsequent
years until the deferred compensation is paid out. Amounts deferred in 2015 earn
interest at a rate of 3.65%. Participants can elect to receive lump sum
distributions or quarterly installments for periods up to ten years.
Participants also can elect between lump sum distributions and quarterly
installments to be received by designated beneficiaries if the participant dies
before distribution of deferred compensation is completed.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Participants may
not withdraw amounts from their accounts until they leave Kroger, except that
Kroger has discretion to approve an early distribution to a participant upon the
occurrence of an unforeseen emergency. Participants who are &#147;specified
employees&#148; under Section 409A of the Internal Revenue Code, which includes the
NEOs, may not receive a post-termination distribution for at least six months
following separation. If the employee dies prior to or during the distribution
period, the remainder of the account will be distributed to his designated
beneficiary in lump sum or quarterly installments, according to the
participant&#146;s prior election.</FONT></P>
<P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial>44</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<P align=left><B><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Harris Teeter Flexible Deferral
Plan</FONT></I></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Mr. Morganthall
participates in the HT Flexible Deferral Plan, which is a nonqualified deferred
compensation plan that provides certain highly compensated employees of Harris
Teeter, the opportunity to defer the receipt and taxation on a portion of their
annual compensation and supplements the benefits under tax qualified retirement
plans to the extent that such benefits are subject to limitation under the
Internal Revenue Code. Participants may elect to defer up to 50% of their base
salary and up to 90% of their non-equity incentive bonus compensation. Harris
Teeter provides matching contributions of 50% of the participant&#146;s contribution,
up to a maximum of 4% of the participant&#146;s pay, less assumed matching
contributions under the HT Savings Plan. These deferred amounts and Company
match are credited to the participant&#146;s account. Plan participants may choose
deemed investments in the HT Flexible Deferral Plan that represent choices that
span a variety of diversified asset classes. Participants may elect to receive a
lump sum distribution, annual installment payments for 2-15 years, or a partial
lump sum and installment payments. Upon retirement, death, disability, or other
separation of service, the participant will receive distributions in accordance
with his election, subject to limitations under Section 409A. Mr. Morganthall
has reached the retirement age and is eligible for the full benefit. The HT
Flexible Deferral Plan also allows for an in-service withdrawal for an
unforeseeable emergency based on facts and circumstances that meet Internal
Revenue Service and plan guidelines. Harris Teeter uses a non-qualified trust to
purchase and hold the assets to satisfy Harris Teeter&#146;s obligation under the HT
Flexible Deferral Plan, and participants in the HT Flexible Deferral Plan are
general creditors of Harris Teeter in the event Harris Teeter becomes
insolvent.</FONT></P>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Potential Payments upon Termination or
Change in Control</FONT></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Kroger does not
have employment agreements or other contracts, agreements, plans or arrangements
that provide for payments to the NEOs in connection with a termination of
employment or a change in control of Kroger. However, KEPP, our award agreements
for stock options, restricted stock and performance units and our long-term cash
bonus plans provide for certain payments and benefits to participants, including
the NEOs, in the event of a termination of employment or a change in control of
Kroger, as described below. Our pension plans and nonqualified deferred
compensation plan also provide for certain payments and benefits to participants
in the event of a termination of employment, as described above in the Pension
Benefits section and the Nonqualified Deferred Compensation section,
respectively.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>A &#147;change in
control&#148; under KEPP, and our equity and non-equity incentive awards occurs
if:</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>any person or entity (excluding
      Kroger&#146;s employee benefit plans) acquires 20% or more of the voting power
      of Kroger;<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>a merger, consolidation, share
      exchange, division, or other reorganization or transaction with Kroger
      results in Kroger&#146;s voting securities existing prior to that event
      representing less than 60% of the combined voting power immediately after
      the event;<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Kroger&#146;s shareholders approve a plan
      of complete liquidation or winding up of Kroger or an agreement for the
      sale or disposition of all or substantially all of Kroger&#146;s assets;
      or<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>during any period of 24 consecutive
      months, individuals at the beginning of the period who constituted
      Kroger&#146;s Board of Directors cease for any reason to constitute at least a
      majority of the Board of Directors.</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P align=left><B><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>KEPP</FONT></I></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>KEPP applies to
all management employees and administrative support personnel who are not
covered by a collective bargaining agreement, with at least one year of service,
and provides severance benefits when a participant&#146;s employment is terminated
actually or constructively within two years following a change in control of
Kroger, including the NEOs. The actual amount is dependent on pay level and
years of service. The NEOs are eligible for the following benefits:</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>a lump sum severance payment equal
      to up to two times the sum of the participant&#146;s annual base salary and 70%
      of the greater of the current annual cash bonus potential or the average
      of the actual annual cash bonus payments for the prior three years;
      </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial>45</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>a lump sum payment equal to the
      participant&#146;s accrued and unpaid vacation, including banked
      vacation;<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>a lump sum payment equal to
      1/12<SUP>th</SUP> of the sum of the participant&#146;s annual vacation pay plus
      70% of the greater of the current year&#146;s annual cash bonus potential or
      the average of the actual annual cash bonus payments for the prior three
      years, multiplied by the number of months elapsed in the current calendar
      year;<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>continued medical and dental
      benefits for up to 24 months and continued life insurance coverage for up
      to 6 months; and<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>up to $5,000 as reimbursement for
      eligible tuition expenses and up to $10,000 as reimbursement for eligible
      outplacement expenses. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Payments to
executive officers under KEPP will be reduced, to the extent necessary, so that
payments will not exceed 2.99 times the officer&#146;s average W-2 earnings over the
preceding five years.</FONT></P>
<P align=left><B><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Long-Term Compensation
Awards</FONT></I></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>The following
table describes the treatment of long-term compensation awards following a
termination of employment or change in control of Kroger. In each case, the
continued vesting, exercisability or eligibility for the incentive awards will
end if the participant provides services to a competitor of Kroger.</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="LINE-HEIGHT: normal; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR vAlign=bottom>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 4pt; WIDTH: 19%; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #c0c0c0; TEXT-ALIGN: center" noWrap><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Triggering Event</FONT></B></TD>
    <TD style="PADDING-LEFT: 4pt; WIDTH: 19%; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #c0c0c0; TEXT-ALIGN: center" noWrap><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Stock Options</FONT></B></TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid" noWrap align=center width="1%" bgColor=#c0c0c0>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid" noWrap align=center width="19%" bgColor=#c0c0c0><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Restricted Stock</FONT></B></TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid" noWrap align=center width="1%" bgColor=#c0c0c0>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid" noWrap align=center width="19%" bgColor=#c0c0c0><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Performance Units</FONT></B></TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid" noWrap align=center width="1%" bgColor=#c0c0c0>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid" noWrap align=center width="20%" bgColor=#c0c0c0><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Performance-Based<BR>Long-Term
      Cash Bonus</FONT></B></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="BORDER-RIGHT: #000000 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 4pt; WIDTH: 19%; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; TEXT-ALIGN: left" noWrap>
      <P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=1>Involuntary<BR>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Termination</FONT></B></P></TD>
    <TD style="PADDING-LEFT: 4pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; WIDTH: 19%; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; TEXT-ALIGN: left">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=1>Forfeit all unvested options.
      Previously vested options remain exercisable for the shorter of one year
      after termination or the remainder of the original 10-year
    term.</FONT></P></TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid" vAlign=top align=left width="1%"></TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid" vAlign=top align=left width="19%">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=1>Forfeit all unvested
      shares</FONT></P></TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid" vAlign=top align=left width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid" vAlign=top align=left width="19%">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=1>Forfeit all rights to units for
      which the three year performance period has not ended</FONT></P></TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid" vAlign=top align=center width="1%"></TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid" vAlign=top align=center width="20%">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=1>Forfeit all rights to long-term cash
      bonuses for which the three year performance period has not
      ended</FONT></P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="BORDER-RIGHT: #000000 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 4pt; WIDTH: 19%; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; TEXT-ALIGN: left" noWrap>
      <P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=1>Voluntary<BR>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Termination/<BR>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></B><B><FONT face=Arial size=1>Retirement</FONT></B></P>
      <P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=1>- Prior to
      minimum<BR>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;age and
      five<BR>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;years
      of<BR>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;service(2)</FONT></B></P></TD>
    <TD style="PADDING-LEFT: 4pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; WIDTH: 19%; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; TEXT-ALIGN: left">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=1>Forfeit all unvested options.
      Previously vested options remain exercisable for the shorter of one year
      after termination or the remainder of the original 10-year
    term.</FONT></P></TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid" vAlign=top align=left width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid" vAlign=top align=left width="19%">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=1>Forfeit all unvested
      shares</FONT></P></TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid" vAlign=top align=left width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid" vAlign=top align=left width="19%">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=1>Forfeit all rights to units for
      which the three year performance period has not ended</FONT></P></TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid" vAlign=top align=center width="1%"></TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid" vAlign=top align=center width="20%">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=1>Forfeit all rights to long-term cash
      bonuses for which the three year performance period has not
      ended</FONT></P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="BORDER-RIGHT: #000000 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 4pt; WIDTH: 19%; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; TEXT-ALIGN: left" noWrap>
      <P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=1>Voluntary<BR>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></B><B><FONT face=Arial size=1>Termination/<BR>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Retirement</FONT></B></P>
      <P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=1>- After minimum
      age<BR>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></B><B><FONT face=Arial size=1>and five years
      of<BR>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;service(2)</FONT></B></P></TD>
    <TD style="PADDING-LEFT: 4pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; WIDTH: 19%; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; TEXT-ALIGN: left">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=1>Unvested options continue vesting on
      the original schedule. All options are exercisable for remainder of the
      original 10-year term.</FONT></P></TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid" vAlign=top align=left width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid" vAlign=top align=left width="19%">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=1>Forfeit all unvested shares granted
      prior to 2013. Vesting continues on the original schedule for awards
      granted during or after 2013. </FONT></P></TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid" vAlign=top align=left width="1%"></TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid" vAlign=top align=left width="19%">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=1>Pro rata portion(1) of units earned
      based on performance results over the full three-year period
</FONT></P></TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid" vAlign=top align=center width="1%"></TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid" vAlign=top align=center width="20%">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=1>Pro rata portion(1) of long-term
      cash bonuses earned based on performance results over the full three-year
      period </FONT></P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="BORDER-RIGHT: #000000 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 4pt; WIDTH: 19%; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; TEXT-ALIGN: left" noWrap>
      <P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=1>Death</FONT></B></P></TD>
    <TD style="PADDING-LEFT: 4pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; WIDTH: 19%; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; TEXT-ALIGN: left">

      vested. All options are exercisable for remainder of the original 10-year

      in<BR>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Control(3)</FONT></B></P></TD>

    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid" vAlign=top align=center width="20%">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=1>50% of the maximum bonus granted at
      the beginning of the performance period earned immediately
  </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE><BR>
<P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial>46</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<TABLE cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 border=0>

  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT face=Arial size=2>(1)</FONT></TD>
    <TD noWrap>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="100%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>The prorated amount is equal to
      the number of weeks of active employment during the performance period
      divided by the total number of weeks in the performance
  period.</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD width="100%" colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT face=Arial size=2>(2)</FONT></TD>
    <TD noWrap></TD>
    <TD width="100%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>The minimum age requirement is
      age 62 for stock options and restricted stock and age 55 for performance
      units and the long-term cash bonus.</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD width="100%" colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT face=Arial size=2>(3)</FONT></TD>
    <TD noWrap></TD>
    <TD width="100%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>These benefits are payable upon a
      change in control of Kroger with or without a termination of
      employment.</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P align=left><B><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Quantification of Payments upon
Termination or Change in Control</FONT></I></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>The following
table provides information regarding certain potential payments that would have
been made to the NEOs if the triggering event occurred on the last day of the
fiscal year, January 30, 2016, given compensation, age and service levels as of
that date and, where applicable, based on the closing market price per Kroger
common share on the last trading day of the fiscal year ($38.81 on January 29,
2016). Amounts actually received upon the occurrence of a triggering event will
vary based on factors such as the timing during the year of such event, the
market price of Kroger common shares, and the officer&#146;s age, length of service
and compensation levels.</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR style="line-height: normal">
    <TD NOWRAP STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: bottom; text-align: center; width: 78%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt"><STRONG><FONT face=Arial size=1>Name</FONT></STRONG></TD>
    <TD NOWRAP STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: bottom; text-align: left; width: 1%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD NOWRAP COLSPAN="4" STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: bottom; text-align: center; width: 4%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt"><STRONG><FONT face=Arial size=1>Involuntary <BR>Termination </FONT></STRONG></TD>
    <TD NOWRAP STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: bottom; text-align: center; width: 1%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD NOWRAP COLSPAN="4" STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: bottom; text-align: center; width: 4%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt"><STRONG><FONT face=Arial size=1>Voluntary<BR>Termination/<BR>Retirement</FONT></STRONG></TD>
    <TD NOWRAP STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: bottom; text-align: center; width: 1%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD NOWRAP STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: bottom; text-align: center; width: 65%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt"><STRONG><FONT face=Arial size=1>Name</FONT></STRONG></TD>

    <TD NOWRAP COLSPAN="4" STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; vertical-align: bottom; text-align: center; width: 8%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt">
      <P><STRONG><FONT face=Arial size=1>Voluntary<BR><STRONG><FONT face=Arial size=1>Termination/<BR></FONT></STRONG></FONT></STRONG><STRONG><FONT face=Arial size=1>Retirement</FONT></STRONG></P></TD>

  <TR vAlign=bottom>

    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid" noWrap align=left width="1%" bgColor=#c0c0c0></TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid" noWrap align=right width="1%" bgColor=#c0c0c0><FONT face=Arial size=1>&#151;</FONT></TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid" noWrap align=right width="1%" bgColor=#c0c0c0></TD></TR></TABLE>

<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>
<TABLE cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 border=0>

  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT face=Arial size=2>(1)</FONT></TD>
    <TD noWrap>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="100%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>Represents the aggregate present
      value of continued participation in the Company&#146;s medical, dental and
      executive term life insurance plans, based on the premiums paid by the
      Company during the eligible period. The eligible period for continued
      medical and dental benefits is based on the length of service, which is 22
      months for Mr. Hjelm, and 24 months for the other NEOs. The eligible
      period for continued executive term life insurance coverage is six months
      for all NEOs. The amounts reported may ultimately be lower if the
      executive is no longer eligible to receive benefits, which could occur
      upon obtaining other employment and becoming eligible for substantially
      equivalent benefits through the new employer.</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD width="100%" colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT face=Arial size=2>(2)</FONT></TD>
    <TD noWrap></TD>
    <TD width="100%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>Amounts reported in the death,
      disability and change in control columns represent the intrinsic value of
      the accelerated vesting of unvested stock options, calculated as the
      difference between the exercise price of the stock option and the closing
      price per Kroger common share on January 29, 2016. In accordance with SEC
      rules, no amount is reported in the voluntary termination/retirement
      column because vesting is not accelerated, but the awards may continue to
      vest on the original schedule if the conditions described above are
      met.</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD width="100%" colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT face=Arial size=2>(3)</FONT></TD>
    <TD noWrap></TD>
    <TD width="100%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>Amounts reported in the death,
      disability and change in control columns represent the aggregate value of
      the accelerated vesting of restricted stock. In accordance with SEC rules,
      no amount is reported in the voluntary termination/retirement column
      because vesting is not accelerated, but the awards may continue to vest on
      the original schedule if the conditions described above are
  met.</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD width="100%" colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT face=Arial size=2>(4)</FONT></TD>
    <TD noWrap></TD>
    <TD width="100%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>Amounts reported in the voluntary
      termination/retirement, death and disability columns represent the
      aggregate value of the performance units granted in 2014 and 2015, based
      on the probable outcome of the performance conditions as of January 30,
      2016 and prorated for the portion of the performance period completed.
      Amounts reported in the change in control column represent the aggregate
      value of 50% of the maximum number of performance units granted in 2014
      and 2015 at the beginning of the performance period. Awards under the 2013
      Long-Term Incentive Plan were earned as of the last day of 2015 so each
      NEO was entitled to receive (regardless of the triggering event) the
      amount actually earned, which is reported in the Stock Awards column of
      the 2015 Stock Vested Table.</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD width="100%" colSpan=3>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT face=Arial size=2>(5)</FONT></TD>
    <TD noWrap></TD>
    <TD width="100%"><FONT face=Arial size=2>Amounts reported in the voluntary
      termination/retirement, death and disability columns represent the
      aggregate value of the long-term cash bonuses granted in 2014 and 2015,
      based on the probable outcome of the performance conditions as of January
      30, 2016 and prorated for the portion of the performance period completed.
      Amounts reported in the change in control column represent the aggregate
      value of 50% of the long-term cash bonus potentials under the 2014 and
      2015 Long-Term Incentive Plans. Awards under the 2013 Long-Term Incentive
      Plan were earned as of the last day of 2015, so each NEO was entitled to
      receive (regardless of the triggering event) the amount actually earned,
      which is reported in the Non-Equity Incentive Plan Compensation column of
      the Summary Compensation Table.</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial>48</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Item 2. Advisory Vote on Executive
Compensation</FONT></B></P>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>You are being asked to vote, on an
advisory basis, to approve the compensation of our NEOs. The Board of Directors
recommends that you vote FOR the approval of compensation of our NEOs.
</FONT></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>The Dodd-Frank
Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act, enacted in July 2010, requires
that we give our shareholders the right to approve, on a nonbinding, advisory
basis, the compensation of our NEOs as disclosed earlier in this proxy statement
in accordance with the SEC&#146;s rules.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>As discussed
earlier in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, our compensation philosophy
is to attract and retain the best management talent and to motivate these
employees to achieve our business and financial goals. Our incentive plans are
designed to reward the actions that lead to long-term value creation. To achieve
our objectives, we seek to ensure that compensation is competitive and that
there is a direct link between pay and performance. To do so, we are guided by
the following principles:</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>A significant portion of pay should
      be performance-based, with the percentage of total pay tied to performance
      increasing proportionally with an executive&#146;s level of
      responsibility;<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Compensation should include
      incentive-based pay to drive performance, providing superior pay for
      superior performance, including both a short- and long-term
      focus;<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Compensation policies should include
      an opportunity for, and a requirement of, equity ownership to align the
      interests of executives and shareholders; and<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Components of compensation should be
      tied to an evaluation of business and individual performance measured
      against metrics that directly drive our business strategy.
  </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>The vote on this
resolution is not intended to address any specific element of compensation.
Rather, the vote relates to the compensation of our NEOs as described in this
proxy statement. The vote is advisory. This means that the vote is not binding
on Kroger. The Compensation Committee of the Board is responsible for
establishing executive compensation. In so doing that Compensation Committee
will consider, along with all other relevant factors, the results of this
vote.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-LEFT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>We ask our
shareholders to vote on the following resolution:</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-LEFT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>&#147;RESOLVED, that
the compensation paid to the Company&#146;s NEOs, as disclosed pursuant to Item 402
of Regulation S-K, including the Compensation Discussion and Analysis,
compensation tables, and the related narrative discussion, is hereby
APPROVED.&#148;</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-LEFT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>The next
advisory vote will occur at our 2017 annual meeting. </FONT></P>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>The Board of Directors Recommends a
Vote <U>For</U> This Proposal.</FONT></B></P>
<P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial>49</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

<P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial>50</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Annual Compensation</FONT></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Each
non-employee director receives an annual cash retainer of $85,000. The chairs of
each of the Audit Committee and the Compensation Committee receive an additional
annual cash retainer of $20,000. The chair of each of the other committees
receives an additional annual cash retainer of $15,000. Each member of the Audit
Committee receives an additional annual cash retainer of $10,000. The director
designated as the Lead Director receives an additional annual cash retainer of
$25,000. </FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Approximately
$165,000 worth of incentive shares (Kroger common shares) are issued to
non-employee directors as a portion of the directors&#146; overall compensation. On
July 15, 2015, each non-employee director, except for Ms. Gates, received 4,320
common shares. Ms. Gates received 2,386 common shares on December 10, 2015 upon
joining the Board. </FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>The Board has
determined that compensation of non-employee directors must be competitive on an
ongoing basis to attract and retain directors who meet the qualifications for
service on the Board. Non-employee director compensation will be reviewed from
time to time as the Corporate Governance Committee deems appropriate.</FONT></P>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Pension Plan</FONT></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Non-employee
directors first elected prior to July 17, 1997 receive an unfunded retirement
benefit equal to the average cash compensation for the five calendar years
preceding retirement. Only Mr. Moore is eligible for this benefit. Participants
who retire from the Board prior to age 70 will be credited with 50% vesting
after five years of service, and 10% for each additional year up to a maximum of
100%. Benefits for participants who retire prior to age 70 begin at the later of
actual retirement or age 65. </FONT></P>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Nonqualified Deferred
Compensation</FONT></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>We also maintain
a deferred compensation plan for non-employee directors. Participants may defer
up to 100% of their cash compensation and/or the receipt of all (and not less
than all) of the annual award of incentive shares. </FONT></P>
<P align=left><B><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Cash Deferrals</FONT></I></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Cash deferrals
are credited to a participant&#146;s deferred compensation account. Participants may
elect from either or both of the following two alternative methods of
determining benefits:</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>interest accrues until paid out at
      the rate of interest determined prior to the beginning of the deferral
      year to represent Kroger&#146;s cost of ten-year debt;
      and/or<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="99%">
      <P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>amounts are credited in &#147;phantom&#148;
      stock accounts and the amounts in those accounts fluctuate with the price
      of Kroger common shares. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>In both cases,
deferred amounts are paid out only in cash, based on deferral options selected
by the participant at the time the deferral elections are made. Participants can
elect to have distributions made in a lump sum or in quarterly installments, and
may make comparable elections for designated beneficiaries who receive benefits
in the event that deferred compensation is not completely paid out upon the
death of the participant.</FONT></P>
<P align=left><B><I><FONT face=Arial size=2>Incentive Share
Deferrals</FONT></I></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Participants may
also defer the receipt of all (and not less than all) of the annual award of
incentive shares. Distributions will be made by delivery of Kroger common shares
within 30 days after the date which is 6 months after the participant&#146;s
separation of service.</FONT></P>
<P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial>51</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Beneficial Ownership of Common
Stock</FONT></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>The following
table sets forth the common shares beneficially owned as of April 1, 2016 by
Kroger&#146;s directors, the NEOs, and the directors and executive officers as a
group. The percentage of ownership is based on 964,367,417 of Kroger common
shares outstanding on April 1, 2016. Shares reported as beneficially owned
include shares held indirectly through Kroger&#146;s defined contribution plans and
other shares held indirectly, as well as shares subject to stock options
exercisable on or before May 31, 2016. Except as otherwise noted, each
beneficial owner listed in the table has sole voting and investment power with
regard to the common shares beneficially owned by such owner.</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="LINE-HEIGHT: 14pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR vAlign=bottom style="line-height: normal">
    <TD NOWRAP STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; text-align: center; width: 88%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt"><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Name</FONT></B></TD>
    <TD NOWRAP STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; text-align: center; width: 1%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD NOWRAP COLSPAN="3" STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; text-align: center; width: 5%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt"><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Amount and<BR><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Nature of</FONT></B><BR><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Beneficial</FONT></B><BR><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Ownership</FONT></B><B><FONT face=Arial size=2><SUP>(1)<BR></SUP></FONT></B>(a)</FONT></B></TD>
    <TD NOWRAP STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; text-align: center; width: 1%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD NOWRAP COLSPAN="3" STYLE="border-bottom: #000000 1pt solid; text-align: center; width: 5%; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt">
      <P><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Options<BR><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Exercisable on</FONT></B><BR><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>or before

<P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Section 16(a) Beneficial Ownership
Reporting Compliance</FONT></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Section 16(a) of
the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 requires our officers and directors, and
persons who own more than 10% of a registered class of our equity securities, to
file reports of ownership and changes in ownership with the SEC. Those officers,
directors and shareholders are required by SEC regulation to furnish us with
copies of all Section 16(a) forms they file.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Based solely on
our review of the copies of Forms 3 and 4 received by Kroger, and any written
representations from certain reporting persons that no Forms 5 were required for
those persons, we believe that during 2015 all filing requirements applicable to
our executive officers, directors and 10% beneficial owners were timely
satisfied, with the following exception. In August 2015, Michael L. Ellis, who
retired as President and Chief Operating Officer of the Company in July 2015,
was 2 days late in the filing of a Form 4 to report a stock purchase in the
amount of 500 shares.</FONT></P>
<P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Related Person
Transactions</FONT></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>The Board has
adopted a written policy requiring that any Related Person Transaction may be
consummated or continue only if the Audit Committee approves or ratifies the
transaction in accordance with the policy. A &#147;Related Person Transaction&#148; is one
(a) involving Kroger, (b) in which one of our directors, nominees for director,
executive officers, or greater than five percent shareholders, or their
immediate family members, have a direct or indirect material interest; and (c)
the amount involved exceeds $120,000 in a fiscal year.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>The Audit
Committee will approve only those Related Person Transactions that are in, or
not inconsistent with, the best interests of Kroger and its shareholders, as
determined by the Audit Committee in good faith in accordance with its business
judgment. No director may participate in any review, approval or ratification of
any transaction if he or she, or an immediate family member, has a direct or
indirect material interest in the transaction.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: 15pt" align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>Where a Related
Person Transaction will be ongoing, the Audit Committee may establish guidelines
for management to follow in its ongoing dealings with the related person and the
Audit Committee will review and assess the relationship on an annual basis to
ensure it complies with such guidelines and that the Related Person Transaction
remains appropriate.</FONT></P>
<P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial>53</FONT></B></P>


<HR align=center width="100%" noshade SIZE=2>
<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<!-- G -->
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Item No. 3 Ratification of the
Appointment of Kroger&#146;s Independent Auditor </FONT></B></P>

<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>You are being asked to ratify the appointment of Kroger&#146;s independent
auditor, PricewaterhouseCoopers LLC. The Board of Directors recommends that you
vote FOR the ratification of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as our independent
registered public accounting firm.</FONT></B></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>The primary function of the Audit
Committee is assist the Board of Directors in fulfilling its oversight
responsibilities regarding the Company&#146;s financial reporting and accounting
practices including the integrity of the Company&#146;s financial statements; the
Company&#146;s compliance with legal and regulatory requirements; the independent
public accountants&#146; qualifications and independence; the performance of the
Company&#146;s internal audit function and independent public accountants; and the
preparation of the Audit Committee Report. The Audit Committee performs this
work pursuant to a written charter approved by the Board of Directors. The Audit
Committee charter most recently was revised during fiscal 2012 and is available
on the Company&#146;s website at ir.kroger.com under Corporate Governance &#150; Committee
Composition. The Audit Committee has implemented procedures to assist it during
the course of each fiscal year in devoting the attention that is necessary and
appropriate to each of the matters assigned to it under the Committee&#146;s charter.
The Audit Committee held five meetings during fiscal year 2015.</FONT></P>
<P align=left><B><FONT face=Arial size=2>Selection of Independent
Auditor</FONT></B></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>The Audit Committee of the Board of
Directors is directly responsible for the appointment, compensation, retention,
and oversight of Kroger&#146;s independent auditor, as required by law and by
applicable NYSE rules. On March 9, 2016, the Audit Committee appointed
PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as Kroger&#146;s independent auditor for the fiscal year
ending January 28, 2017.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>In determining whether to reappoint the
independent auditor, our Audit Committee:</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial>Reviews PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP&#146;s
      independence and performance;</FONT> <BR>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial>Reviews, in advance, all non-audit
      services provided by PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP, specifically</FONT> <FONT face=Arial size=2>with regard to the effect on the firm&#146;s
      independence;</FONT> <BR>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial>Conducts an annual assessment of
      PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP&#146;s performance, including an</FONT> <FONT face=Arial size=2>internal survey of their service quality by members of
      management and the Audit Committee;</FONT> <BR>&nbsp;</TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial>Conducts regular executive sessions with
      PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP;</FONT> <BR>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial>Conducts regular executive sessions with
      the Vice President of Internal Audit;</FONT> <BR>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial>Considers PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP&#146;s
      familiarity with our operations, businesses, accounting</FONT> <FONT face=Arial size=2>policies and practices and internal control over
      financial reporting;</FONT> <BR>&nbsp;</TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial>Reviews candidates for the lead
      engagement partner in conjunction with the mandated rotation of</FONT>
      <FONT face=Arial size=2>the public accountants&#146; lead engagement
      partner;</FONT> <BR>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial>Reviews recent Public Company Accounting
      Oversight Board reports on PricewaterhouseCoopers</FONT> <FONT face=Arial size=2>LLP and its peer firms; and</FONT> <BR>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD style="PADDING-RIGHT: 8pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" vAlign=top width="1%"><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 9.5pt">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
    <TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="99%" STYLE="text-align: left"><FONT face=Arial>Obtains and reviews a report from
      PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP describing all relationships</FONT> <FONT face=Arial size=2>between the independent auditor and Kroger at least
      annually to assess the independence of the</FONT> <FONT face=Arial size=2>internal auditor.</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>As a result, the members of the Audit
Committee believe that the continued retention of </FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2>PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP to serve as our independent registered public
accounting firm is in the best interests of our company and its
shareholders.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>While shareholder ratification of the
selection of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as our independent auditor is not
required by Kroger&#146;s Regulations or otherwise, the Board of Directors is
submitting the selection of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP to shareholders for
ratification, as it has in past years, as a good corporate governance practice.
If the shareholders fail to ratify the selection, the Audit Committee
</FONT></P>
<P align=center><B><FONT face=Arial>54</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<P align=left><FONT face=Arial size=2>may, but is not required to, reconsider
whether to retain that firm. Even if the selection is ratified, the Audit
Committee in its discretion may direct the appointment of a different auditor at
any time during the year if it determines that such a change would be in the
best interests of our company and our shareholders.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="text-indent: 15pt"><FONT face=Arial size=2>A representative of PricewaterhouseCoopers
LLP is expected to be present at the meeting to respond to appropriate questions
and to make a statement if he or she desires to do so.</FONT></P>
